column2: Gain meaningful field sales experience in selling industrial products. Initially, the role holder will undergo an intensive training program covering Sales, Product Groups, Technical, and Service capabilities of the organization. Final placement will be in a city in the western region upon completion of training and based on business requirements, ensuring you are equipped to excel in your role.        WITHIN YOUR ROLE, YOU WILL:       Comprehensive Training:   Immerse yourself in a thorough training program that includes shadowing senior team members, visiting customer sites, and receiving guidance from the National Head of IEU Sales Team. Youll gain insights into the Sales Process, Service Process, Core Product Groups, and Technical competencies critical for success in the role.    Territory Management:   Take ownership of an independent territory upon successful completion of training. This entails managing the territorys operations, executing strategic business plans to meet revenue targets, and ensuring customer satisfaction through effective service delivery.    Customer Engagement:   Build and nurture long-term relationships with customers, understanding their needs, and delivering solutions that add value. Youll be instrumental in driving customer satisfaction and loyalty, contributing to the overall growth and success of the organization.    Sales Optimization:   Utilize sales tools such as "sales funnels" and SFDC to enhance sales efficiency and effectiveness. Analyze market trends, identify opportunities for growth, and develop strategies to capitalize on them, driving continuous improvement in sales performance.    Extensive Travel:   Travel extensively to understand the market dynamics, visit various customer types, and explore different territories. This hands-on approach will provide valuable insights into regional nuances, customer preferences, and market trends, enabling you to tailor your sales strategies effectively.        KEY COMPETENCIES:       Motivated and Driven:   Demonstrate a strong desire to succeed and the determination to overcome challenges. Your proactive approach and resilience will be key drivers of your success in this role.    Sales Oriented:   Possess a passion for sales and a relentless pursuit of excellence in customer acquisition and retention. Your ability to identify and capitalize on sales opportunities will be instrumental in achieving business objectives.    Team Player:   Collaborate effectively with colleagues across departments, leveraging collective expertise and resources to deliver exceptional results. Your ability to build strong relationships and work collaboratively will be essential for success in a dynamic team environment.    Customer-Oriented Achiever:   Prioritize customer satisfaction and demonstrate a customer-focused attitude in all interactions. Your dedication to meeting and exceeding customer expectations will be instrumental in building long-term partnerships and driving business growth.       WE ARE LOOKING FOR A PROFESSIONAL WHO HAS:      Flexibility and Adaptability:   Be willing to travel extensively based on training demands and business requirements, adapting to changing priorities and environments with ease. Demonstrate readiness to relocate to any major city in the west region, and be flexible to stay at alternate locations for extended periods as required by business demands.    Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills:   Possess strong analytical skills and the ability to analyze technical problems, identify root causes, and develop effective solutions to address them.    Communication and Interpersonal Skills:   Communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders, demonstrating strong verbal and written communication skills to convey ideas clearly and persuasively.    Proactive Thinking:   Exhibit a proactive mindset and a willingness to bring forward new ideas and solutions to meet the evolving needs of customers and stakeholders.    Integrity and Professionalism:   Uphold the highest standards of honesty, integrity, and professionalism in all interactions, demonstrating a commitment to ethical conduct and sound business practices.        YOUR EDUCATION AND BACKGROUND EXPERIENCE WILL INCLUDE:       Engineering Background:   Hold a degree in engineering    Experience:   Freshers can apply. 0-2 years of field sales experience, demonstrating a track record of success in acquiring and retaining customers.

column2: In coherence with the Project Execution Strategy and contract requirements to ascertain that production/process downtime is minimized, set up, monitor and update the overall shutdown project schedule in Primavera or similar tool during all its phases (Initiation to Reporting phases).         Assist the Shutdown Manager and Shutdown Engineer in maintaining the project schedule.         Provide planning inputs to Project Shutdown Management Team in order to issue regular Project Status Report.          Supervise Site Planning Activities and coordinate planning interfaces between the Shore Bases, Units and SD Mgt team.               At Initiation / Scheduling / Preparation phase:            Contribute to the SD PEP definition providing planning set up / organisation         Formulate jointly with Project control / Cost Engineer a Work Breakdown Structure that is coherent with the project execution strategy establishing activity weightings that enable a representative measure of the project progress to be determined.         Initially, formulate high level planning (Summary level 1) including Client and Subcontractors.         Assist Shutdown Engineer to validate works list including Materials, Resources, Services and relative lead time and costs          Formulate detailed and optimised schedules (Levels 2 & 3 ) including Client and Subcontractors to guaranty minimized downtime. This input enables the Shutdown Manager, Client and Management to ascertain project status at any point in time.         Make visible the various schedule requirements to the Project stakeholders (Shutdown Engineer, Execution Centre project team, Supply Chain leads, Material coordinator, Subcontractor(s) and Construction-Intervention Supervisors ) in order to achieve their scope and the overall project on time.         Participate to the Project Planning Meetings and resolve all planning issues in due time.         Produce regular reports such as progress figures, S-curves, look-a-heads , etc to permit the project to be well managed by highlighting planning areas of concern and then to enable the Shutdown Manager to take timely action.         Identify shortcomings in current methods, processes and procedures and propose improvements.         Integrate Sub-schedules, loading and capacity charts into the Master shutdown project schedule and determine feasibility and congruence.         Coordinate and edit the regular schedule update to the Shutdown Manager in line with the corporate and/or contractual requirements, issuing periodical reporting to the Client.         Build and consolidate the POB schedule for the Shutdown period.          Travel to the country as required during the critical phases of the shutdown preparation and execution.             At Project Execution phase:           Analyse daily data and progress; identify Corrective Actions (as and when required) in cooperation with the Shutdown Manager, Shutdown Engineer and Stakeholders.         Incorporate Corrective Actions in the Progress Reports if necessary.         Daily pursue, monitor and record in planning progress in each area of project activity.         Treat urgent request linked to extra and additional work during S/D execution phase             At Reporting phase / Close out:           Ensure as-built planning / schedule is performed and published         Contribute to the post mortem report including final dash board, as-built schedule, financial result and lessons learnt         Prepare the list of activities required for the next SD          Identify shortcomings in current methods, processes and procedures and propose improvements and good practices to be implemented for next shutdown               JOB REQUIREMENTS                  ?       Any engineering degree with total 10+years of planning experience and with at least 2 years hands-on planning experience in an Offshore Oil & Gas industry, shipyard, engineering or project management environment.             - Fluent in English (speaking and writing)           -     Good Communication skills.      Autonomous.           -      Detailed knowledge of Primavera (P6) and Microsoft Project planning software.           - Good IT knowledge, ability to build macros in order to present information in accordance with management requirements.           -      Enough knowledge in reading and understanding of Construction drawings and assembly sequences.           -      Good experience in MS Office and Excel applications.          - Able to travel abroad and offshore on short or long duration basis as required.

column2: As a   Project Procurement Lead (PPL)   within SBM, you have the overall responsibility for the completion (quality, schedule, cost and documentation) of the packages assigned to you     Basically you are the Project Manager of the package as well as the Package Buyer for critical packages    You will need to manage the assigned package from review of engineering documents up to the hand- over to the construction team and, if needed, to assist/ participate in construction/ integration, pre-commissioning and commissioning activities        In the case of this role, the PPL is responsible for E&I equipment      You are part of the core team which will handle a proposal, a FEED or an EPC contract    Your experience and expertise on E&I is required for most key packages like ICSS, HV, LV equipment, but also field instrumentation, transmitters, flowmeters, level and temperature gauges etc             Furthermore you will:             Liaise with the Package Engineer (who is responsible for all technical aspects of the package);            Act as the primary focal point for the Vendor on all matters related to the Package;            Liaise with the Group Strategic Sourcing in regards to the Bidder list, benchmarking and problems faced with Vendors. You will approve the Package Bidder list, Commercial Bid Evaluation, Recommendation to Purchase and Purchase Requisition;            Participate in the RFQ preparation, bid- and Vendor qualification;            Define the negotiation strategy with the Buyer, Project Manager and Supply Chain Department Manager;            You will manage the execution of the PO technically and commercially and you make sure the PO execution is in line with the project schedule;            Ensure the Vendor Documents are received , reviewed and approved on time in the Vendor Documentation Management tool;            Receive, control and close the TQs, NCRs, SVRs in liaison with Engineering and PM;            Manage the inspection, the delivery and receipt of the package at site with the help of the Inspection, Expediting and Logistic teams & Site Material Controller.                 Education and experience                 Furthermore you are or you have:              a self- starter who possesses good interpersonal and organizational skills;            great Time Management skills;            Leadership skills and proactive behavior;            Flexible and adaptable to react to operational changes;            Willingness to travel;            Fluent in English (both written and verbally).

column2: The Project Procurement Manager (PPM) is responsible for Supply Chain activities performed during the project and he/she ensures that services, equipment and materials under Supply Chain (SC) scope are free issued to fabrication yards as per project requirements in terms of safety, cost, schedule and quality.    For all Equipment under Project Management Office (PMO) responsibility, PPM shall provide support to PMO during RFQ phase by leading the buyer team and during the PO execution by providing the Post Order Management (POM) support required by PMO.    The PPM supervises the SC team assigned to the project.    He/she reports progress of the SC Purchase Orders and associated activities to the Project Management Team (PMT), local Supply Chain manager and if required, to the Client representative.       ROLE CONTRIBUTION      1. In order that effective procurement control is established from the beginning of the Execution Phase you are to:     1.1 For the Supply Chain scope, develop the Project Procurement Strategy during the Win Phase with Category Managers, local SC Manager, SBM Operations representative and cascade this to the project SC team.   1.2 Define solutions to address identified clients requirements (eg POs STC set up, "back to back" solutions).   1.3 Define SBM Operations requirement to be considered in the SC strategy.   1.4 Define in coordination with the relevant Category Manager(s) the most appropriate strategy to be implemented for strategic scopes/vendors   1.5 Assess SC project risk and identify associated mitigation actions   1.6 Define lead-time and values for Supply Chain Purchase Orders and associated contingency   1.7 Liaise with Product Line Supply Chain Manager to set up SC budget and associated manpower planning   1.8 Act as the main focal point with estimating department to consolidate project supply chain   information for estimation purposes associated to Supply Chain scope   1.9 Develop Supply Chain Execution Plan (SCEP) when required   1.10 Undertake preparatory project execution activities (SC templates, pre-populating tools, contractual specificities etc)   1.11 Be responsible for monitoring of project supply chain budget and for project supply chain reporting     The measure of your effectiveness in this will be:      Supply Chain scope is clearly identified with associated budget and manhours and validated by PMT and Product Line Supply Chain Manager      2. In order that Supply Chain delivery meets project requirements you are to:          2.1 Lead the project SC team and support them to deliver goods and services allocated to Supply Chain within project constraints, ensuring that the overall quality of purchased equipment and services meets project performance expectations.   2.2 Liaise with PMO for support required to be provided during PO execution to PMO to deliver goods and services allocated to PMO.   2.3 Manage workload and priorities of the project SC team for scope allocated to Supply Chain to ensure compliance with project milestones and liaise with SC Managers to resolve any workload/resourcing issue   2.4 Review and provide input to the project planning to optimize SC activities in line with engineering and construction constraints   2.5 Resolve multi-disciplinary topics with PMT colleagues (Engineering Project Manager, Project Controls Manager, Completion Manager, Delivery/Project Manager, ).   2.6 Get support from SC Managers to ensure SC team members have proper awareness on relevant tools, processes methodology.   2.7 Ensure that all relevant Quality Regulatory Management and HSE, Project and Group Procedures related to supply chain activities are understood and enforced by the project SC team.   2.8 Monitor implementation and ensure compliance Project Procurement Strategy.   2.9 Report to Strategic Sourcing team feedback on applicability of developed strategies or GFA with an ultimate goal of continuous improvement   2.10 Monitor SC risk exposure throughout the project execution phase and implement an appropriate action plan.   2.11 Maintain the Quality and Safety performance of all members of the project SC team      ?    The measure of your effectiveness in this will be:      % of Purchase Orders delivered on time and on budget    SC resource consumption (man-hours) aligned with forecast    External and internal stakeholders satisfaction

column2: The position shall be responsible for driving the growth of the Videojet All Product business, in the Pharma segment and to coordinate the Pharma activities.     Key results will be strong brand recognition and strong sales growth in the Pharma segment, driving all product sales. Develop and maintain detailed account plans for key accounts in designated geo     Focus on both Sales and Service sales to Pharma     Build strong relationships with Key stakeholders and Decision makers at selected Pharma accounts and Pharma OEMs     Identify value-adding marketing activities driving Pharma sales.     Maintain and drive sales pipeline for selected accounts in close cooperation with OEM team and sales teams     Coordinate and close deals at designated pharma accounts Strengthen the Brand of Videojet in key markets.     Work closely with marketing teams to conduct carefully selected and value-added marketing activities, in alignment with the Global Pharma Marketing Strategy.     Develop Strategic Partnerships with key players in the pharma market, to grow sales and brand recognition of Videojet     Give input to Product Development teams with regards to new product development, based on input from clients and partners         KEY COMPETENCIES        Motivated and Driven:   Demonstrate a strong desire to succeed and the determination to overcome challenges. Your proactive approach and resilience will be key drivers of your success in this role.      Team Player:   Collaborate effectively with colleagues across departments, leveraging collective expertise and resources to deliver exceptional results. Your ability to build strong relationships and work collaboratively will be essential for success in a dynamic team environment.      Interpersonal and Communication Skills:   The ability to establish strong relationships with customers, stakeholders, and cross-functional teams is crucial. Excellent communication and interviewing skills to accurately grasp customer needs, foster collaboration, and effectively convey product vision and strategic insights to senior leadership.        WE ARE LOOKING FOR A PROFESSIONAL WHO HAS:       Integrity and Professionalism:   Uphold the highest standards of honesty, integrity, and professionalism in all interactions, demonstrating a commitment to ethical conduct and sound business practices.     Sales acumen and specific experience in designing and leading sales strategy for the Organization     Strategic Planning and Critical Analysis-To be organized and be methodical in handling responsibilities and to ensure that accurate and immediate follow-up is done, to respond quickly to needs to the market, and be alert to situations that may be problem causing     Market knowledge and product knowledge -     Leadership skills -Has to be a team leader, highly efficient and motivating     People management and ability to work under stress-has to be a team leader, highly efficient and motivating     Communication Skills -To be able to effectively deal with customers and other stakeholders.         YOUR EDUCATION AND BACKGROUND EXPERIENCE WILL INCLUDE:       Bachelor s Degree in engineering / MBA or an equivalent degree     Experience: Experience - 5 years of minimum experience in sales experience in any multi-national, process-oriented company, preferably in equipment sales in Pharma Segment     Knowledge of the pharmaceutical market and the marking and coding industry is a must     Knowledge of OEM sales channels     Work experience on CRM Oracle is an additional benefit

column2: Supplier Quality Engineer located at the Siemens Energy (SE) Compressor facility located in Naroda. Supplier Development - initiate and implement pro-active and re-active supplier quality improvement measures using quantitative and qualitative performance metrics. Practical manufacturing experience with welded fabrications. Know how with general assembly testing of systems.             Working experience in technical functions in the Energy, Oil Gas or related industry preferred.             Bachelor s degree, or higher, in engineering related major. Extensive knowledge in welding required, International Welding Engineer (IWE) certification preferred.             Lead Auditor experience or certification preferred.           Initiative, results solution orientation and strong analytical thinking required. Digital skills a plus.           S    trong written and verbal communication         skills    in     English    . Experience working in a global environment.             Familiarity with root cause analysis and other quality risk management methodologies             Willingness to travel ~30%.             Project Management Experience preferred.

column2: Defines and leads engineering solutions within a SSE project taskforce, and acts as a technical and technological referent, in accordance with TechnipFMC standards, procedures and processes, schedules and man hours, with a continuous concern for quality, targets, and customer satisfaction.        Job Description       Leads and supports project engineering, new product/technology development, product improvement and product standardization, and product qualification projects depending upon the assigned group.       Serves as a technical point of contact for assigned work package scope and may serve as a focal point for all communications related to scope.       Develops product design, geometry standards documentation and product qualification requirements.       Creates, reviews/approves part reports, drawings, engineering specifications and standards.       Defines product quality, material, welding, and NDE requirements.       Supports and manage project schedule and deliverables.       Provides Management with technical assistance and work progress updates as requested.       Mentors and provides technical guidance to Product Engineers and Designers/Drafters. Works collaboratively to accomplish project tasks. Provides independent review and approval of work packages.       Provides vendors technical assistance and builds strong working relationships.       Works to the requirements of industry code related to subsea production systems, TechnipFMC standards and client specifications.       Adheres to all relevant work instructions and design guidelines, clearly demonstrates creativity and innovation in finding solutions and alternatives.       Develops unique solutions for complex technical problems that may include the design of new products/systems or the development of solutions having few or no precedents.       This is an individual contributor position. The role is responsible for executing activities assigned by the manager and execute it with the assigned team.      Main Tasks       Consistently work packages and resources on a project basis. Ensures that project members understand business goals and creates energy and action toward those goals. Encourages and empowers others to achieve.       Reviews and approves engineering designs (i.e. drawings, part reports, specifications, etc.) of existing and new technology or projects. Ensures that assignments meet standards and performance requirements within area of expertise.       Actively manages and provides timely updates to engineering schedule, and engineering updates to the project and engineering management team.       Prepares documentation, information, and communications such as ECN (Engineering Change Notices),part reports, and engineering specifications and ensures conformance to all policies and procedures related to engineering functions, labor reporting and systems reporting.       Facilitate RCAs and provide design solutions to correct non-conformances while taking into account safety, quality, schedule, and cost.       Support Quality Notification dispositions and supply chain issues as they arise.       Provide expert technical support to equipment manufacturing, fabrication, assembly, Factory acceptance test (FAT) and System integration test (SIT) activities.       Works with other engineering teams to ensure good communication of work load requirements and consistent approaches to analytical models and methodologies.       Works with technical authorities in the company to define technical requirements which are appropriate for the products and consistent with industry practices.       Finds creative solutions to multi-faceted and/or time-sensitive, complex problems. Identifies and utilizes available technical resources throughout TechnipFMC and externally.       Consults with other departments on equipment designs. Anticipates potential problems and proactively solves complex problems through creative thinking, using internal and external resources.       Prepares technical data and papers for sales personnel, customers, and publications. Makes presentations to customer management groups.       Actively increases industry knowledge base through technical publications, forums, committee participation, trade shows, etc.       Assists engineering manager with any requested technical and engineering related tasks.      You are meant for this job if:       Degreed Mechanical Engineer with at least 8-years of Engineering experience in the Subsea Production System engineering, reduced to 6-years for Masters/PhD candidates.       Demonstrated experience in leading subsea projects constrained by safety, quality, delivery, and cost requirements.       Experience in reviewing & approving engineering designs, documents, layouts, calculations and interpreting FEA/ structural analysis results.       Strong knowledge of engineering discipline and physical modeling techniques (solid mechanics, fluid dynamics, heat transfer) is required. Experience conducting design analysis - hoop stress, flexibility, buckling, burst, fatigue, etc.       Work experience must include experience with various ASME, API, NORSOK, and DNV Codes and Standards as it relates to subsea equipment design and manufacturing.       Exposure to various manufacturing processes - forging, hot and cold extrusion, cladding, HIP, induction bending etc       Exposure to welding codes and practices - ASME IX and API 1104.       Exposure to NDE codes and practices - UT, PAUT, PT, RT, MPI per ASME V.       Ability to manage the engineering projects within specified schedule and budget. Demonstrated organization and project planning skills.       Accuracy, dependability, ability to manage schedule and prioritize work for self and others in team.       Ability to work independently and as a leader of a technical team - a self-motivated self-starter.       Ability to make independent system recommendations utilizing advanced analytical and problem-solving skills.       Strong written and verbal communication skills in English with ability to effectively transfer subject matter expertise. Ability to coach and mentor others.

managing site administration, and assuming economic responsibility for material, personnel and contract costs        Responsibilities     The responsibilities of this role include but are not limited to:     Crafting a comprehensive Project Monitoring plan through collaborative efforts with multiple stakeholders and business units      Identifying and reporting critical paths, sharing key insights periodic project reports while remaining open to identifying additional reports or analysis as needed      Analysing plans and critical paths, offering valuable insights and suggestions for critical  Calculating the potential cost impact due to associated risks and develop action plans to mitigate them      Project Tracking, Control, and Digital PMO:      Continuously tracking and monitoring You will also be responsible for maintaining the proper storage and organization of goods/materials in the store.      Basic computer skills in MS Word and MS Excel will be required for this role. Attention to detail and ability to maintain proper storage and handling of goods/materials.      Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.      Physical stamina to handle lifting and moving of materials as required.

column2: The SLR Program at WRI India is seeking a Senior Program Research Specialist Behavioral Science, Sustainable Landscapes and Restoration to support the ongoing work on food loss and waste. Larger focus of the work would be to catalyze systems change with a focus on circular food systems in India. With an aim to inspire, engage and mobilize action on food loss and food waste in two large states in India as a critical lever to test and pilot strategies - powered by robust evidence and consultations. Centering your focus on equity and inclusion, your role would be to build evidence-based strategies to reduce food loss and waste to stir action and behavioral change. And identify innovative solutions that can enhance livelihoods and improve access to nutritious food by addressing barriers to food loss and food waste.     How your day will unfold:   The position is most suited to an individual who has a specialized degree in behaviour science and has a passion for working in the food sustainability, natural resource management in India. The position holder must be willing to travel to remote locations in the country as well as internationally as necessary.      Research (70%)      Developing behavioral science informed research strategies for reducing food loss and food waste, and ongoing food, land and waste transition work at WRI India. This would include undertaking research, developing research frameworks, and behavior science informed strategies to reduce food loss and waste for a diverse stakeholders across the food supply chain.   Developing high-quality knowledge products (reports, policy briefs, working papers) that encapsulate research findings and communicate these to diverse audiences, for influencing initiatives on reducing food loss and food waste in India.   Stay updated on international and national issues on food loss and food waste and propose strategic opportunities for the program that aligns with strategy.    Partnerships, engagement and communication (30%)     Work closely with food, land and water transition team in WRI India to incorporate behavioral issues in ongoing research.   Support with development of communication and outreach strategy and material like brochures, web content, op-eds, blogs considering behavioral norms and nudges for food and sustainability with the communications team.   Support with program/proje   ct performance against contract   ual   requirements for the project    management    team.       Qualifications and requirements we seek:      Master s degree (or PhD) in behavioral science in food, agriculture, and natural resource management sector or any related disciplines.   At least 7 years post-study research experience relating to behavioral science in food, agriculture, and natural resource management sector   Demonstrated ability to work both independently as well as part of an interdisciplinary team   Demonstrated skills of engaging in participatory approaches, and high levels of comfort in working with scientific data as well as local knowledge. Proficiency in quantitative and qualitative data analysis is a requirement.   Excellent/ Strong research, interpersonal/ written/ communication skills   Ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner   Ability to work calmly and enthusiastically under high pressure and ability to think creatively    Demonstrated skills preparing programme documents, reports, policy briefs etc. and team management.   General awareness of the environment, restoration, agriculture and food domain - key issues, events and updates is essential    Strong ability to communicate clearly and effectively in conversation and writing, including professional-quality writing for policy and communications products.   Fluency in spoken and written English is essential. Additional proficiency in Hindi and Marathi will be advantageous.   Ability to take the initiative, brainstorm, think creatively, juggle multiple priorities and work under pressure with tight deadlines. The candidate must be willing to try new approaches and ideas and be innovative.   Flexible and self-motivated, with capacity to multi-task and prioritize, a self-starter having ability to manage the tasks with minimum guidance   Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint is a requirement.

column2: The purpose is to provide service excellence to our OEM customers by effective inter-departmental coordination within the organization. This position will indirectly contribute to business retention in West Region alone.       WHO WE ARE:       VIDEOJET TECHNOLOGIES is a global leader in product identification providing innovative coding and marking solutions that helps customers ensure product safety and improve their productivity.    Videojet is a part of Veralto s Product Quality Innovation companies, which also includes Esko, Linx, Pantone and X-Rite. Together, they help package and protect the world s food, medicine, and essentials, tracing and authenticating billions of goods that travel the global supply chain every day.    Veralto is a global leader in essential technology solutions with annual revenue of nearly $5 billion and a proven track record of solving some of the most complex challenges we face as a society. Our industry-leading companies and globally recognized brands are building on a long-established legacy of innovation and customer trust to create a safer, cleaner, more vibrant future.    Veralto is headquartered in Waltham, Mass. with 13 operating companies and 300+ locations worldwide. Our global team of 16,000 associates is committed to making an enduring positive impact on the world and is united by a powerful purpose: Safeguarding the World s Most Vital Resources .    Imagine a world where everyone has access to clean water, safe food and medicine, and trusted essential goods. That is the tomorrow Veralto (VLTO) is creating today.    Veralto s Water Quality companies Aquatic Informatics, ChemTreat, Hach, McCrometer, OTT HydroMet, Sea-Bird Scientific, Trojan Technologies and XOS help manage, treat, purify, and protect the global water supply, from municipal and industrial wastewater treatment facilities to lakes, rivers, watersheds, and oceans.    Veralto s Product Quality Innovation companies Esko, Linx, Pantone, Videojet, and X-Rite help package and protect the world s food, medicine, and essentials, tracing and authenticating billions of goods that travel the global supply chain every day.       Primary Responsibilities:       This position will assist OEM Tech Mgr    for various tech support related functions in West and central Region including conclusion of Demos, FATs, Trails at OEM place, supporting OEM customers by training OEM teams with service skills for printer s integrations and commissioning, supporting OEMs at their exhibition places, keeping a track record of installation process at end user customers of OEMs to support OEMs in development of some specific brackets and SOPs    Goal achievement measurement will be based on his KPI         Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:       Education - Graduation / Diploma in Engineering with Electronics or Instrumentation.      Work experience - Minimum of 3 Yrs. field service experience in company offering technical Products. Candidate from existing service team or competition or Packaging service field would be preferred.      Skills required -Technical Knowledge to understand the working and maintenance of almost all Marking and Coding solutions. Customer facing skills. Precise execution of technical service activity. CAD Drawing making and / or working on PLC programming would be considered as added advantage.      Travel - Mumbai / Pune as base location, person will also need to travel with in Maharastra and Madya Pradesh. Against special assignments, he may also be asked to visit other part of country.

column2: Responsible for conducting due diligence of windfarms in operation or under-construction:         - Independently conduct site visits and assessments according to relevant IEC standards.        - Conduct complete turbine due diligence including but not limited to: technology review, Machine Load Analysis (MLA), type tests review, component supply chain review, GTP and others, electrical and mechanical parameters.        - Review turbine load calculations to ensure that turbines operate within their design limits, considering site-specific conditions like extreme wind speeds, turbulence intensity, and temperature variations.        - Design and implement power curve testing procedures based on IEC 61400-12-1 standards or other relevant protocols, ensuring accurate assessment of turbine performance.        - Evaluate and advise on technical aspects of power purchase agreements, turbine supply agreements, service and maintenance contracts, and other related contracts.        - Review environmental impact assessments, particularly focusing on shadow flicker analysis, and acoustic studies to ensure the projects viability and minimal environmental disruption.        - Development of WTG Reliability models and reports        - Visit windfarms and conduct site-level audits and produce crisp reports.        - Collaborate with developers, manufacturers, consultants, and other stakeholders to gather necessary information and ensure transparency during the due diligence process.        - Evaluate the proposed operation and maintenance strategy, considering aspects like accessibility, spare parts availability, and local service capabilities.              Requirements           - Minimum bachelors degree in engineering (Mechanical Engineering).       - 5 years of work experience in relevant industry based on responsibilities as stated above.          - Understanding of windfarms, WTG technologies, energy yield analysis using simulation software.          - Strong analytical skills and an aptitude for analysing statistical data.          - Ability to write and compose clear and accurate reports in English          - Knowledge of the wind Indian market.          - Ability to identify problems, develop solutions, conduct analysis independently and in collaboration with others.          - Proficient use of all Microsoft Office Suite programs.           - Drive continuous improvements by identifying deficiencies in existing tools and methods.          - Available to travel periodically to remote windfarms and Owner/Customer locations in India or abroad.

column2: Responsible for Bill Of Materials (BOM) enrichments for ensuring the completeness, accuracy, and consistency of BOM data within an organization    Work closely with engineering and manufacturing teams to collect, analyze, and enrich BOM data to support product design, manufacturing, asset management/maintenance and supply chain management              Responsibilities;              To lead pro-actively the spares migration activities in the ERP systems updating data in a timely manner                  To ensure data accuracy: This involves verifying the accuracy of BOM data, including part numbers, descriptions, quantities, and costs, and ensuring that it is consistent with engineering and manufacturing specifications. This involves adding additional data to the BOM, such as supplier information, lead times, and alternative parts, to support supply chain management and cost optimization                 To manage BOM change requests and ensuring that all changes are documented and approved in accordance with company procedures                 To collaborating with cross-functional teams. This involves working closely with engineering, manufacturing, procurement, and quality teams to ensure that BOM data meets the needs of each department                 To select data quality metrics. This involves developing and monitoring data quality metrics to ensure that BOM data is accurate, complete, and consistent                 To develop data management procedures. This involves developing and implementing procedures for BOM data management, including data entry, verification, enrichment, and change management.                 Strive towards LEAN Processes                  Train personnel in BOM activities fundamentals and department initiatives as required Input to minimum/maximum holding levels                    Job requirements:                   Degree Level/Technical Qualification in an Engineering Discipline                 Minimum 3-10 years experiences in:                  Rotating activities      : Intermediate knowledge in turbo-compressors, screw compressors, diesel engines, cranes, centrifugal pumps, duplex/triplex pumps, etc Previous experience on equipment and spare parts specification for rotating equipment                  Static Equipment activities      : Intermediate knowledge in gate-ball, plug, butterfly valves, heat exchangers, separators, chokes, etc Previous experience on equipment and spare parts specification for valves and static equipment                   Electrical activities      : Intermediate knowledge in electric motors, panels, transducers, sensors, junction boxes, EEX equipment, etc Previous experience on equipment and spare parts specification for electric equipment and instrumentation                 FPSO or experience within the Oil and Gas Industry preferred but not essential                 A good understanding of major packages and cross-discipline awareness                 To apply a pro-active approach to retrieve information from Subject Matter Experts when working area of technical expertise.                 Good working knowledge of CMMS ERP Systems (IFS or similar)                 ISO 14224 Awareness preferred                   Behaviours inter-personal skills - Key points:                    Ability to communicate with various stakeholders and adapt to a multicultural environment

column2: Our Vision.      SBM Offshore believes the oceans will provide the world with safe, sustainable and affordable energy for generations to come. We share our experience to make it happen.        Our Profile.      We design, build, install and operate offshore floating facilities for the offshore energy industry. As a leading technology provider, we put our marine expertise at the service of a responsible energy transition by reducing emissions from fossil fuel production, while developing cleaner solutions for renewable energy sources. More than 7,000 SBMers worldwide are committed to sharing their experience to deliver safe, sustainable and affordable energy from the oceans for generations to come. Together, we are driving progress forward in a TRUE. BLUE. TRANSITION.        #OGJS                CONTRACT MANAGER                   BROWN FIELD PROJECTS                    RESPONSIBILITIES & MAIN TASKS                    Provide the Project Manager and his/her leads as part of the PMT with Contract Management Support.                 Lead the formation, negotiation and execution of Enabling Agreement and Work Order terms for Project Work.                 Lead, coordinate and present in conjunction with the Project Manager, Enabling Agreement proposals and then upon gate review approval, oversee Work Order execution.                 Provide PMT with breakdown of the Enabling Agreement & Work Order contracting terms.                 Assess changes, claims and delays under the Enabling Agreement and Work Order terms.                 Assist the Project Manager and PMT if work executed through intercompany agreements.                 Prepare strategies and plans to overcome commercial / contractual exposures.                 Liaise with Insurance for event coverage, under CAR, P&I, H&M, WC, PL and IP policies.                 Assist supply chain professionals with the preparation of standard forms of contracting for subcontracting for services and supply of goods and materials; and                 Assist with any supply chain, exposures, claims and delays; and when to manage issues up (in conjunction with PMT) to the Client.                 Maintain accurate records for all correspondence, Change Orders, Commercial Exposures and Claims, Amendments and Invoicing and keep PMT regularly updated.                 Coordinate PMT and Subject Matter Expert input for Change Order Proposals / Change Orders, Letters and Amendments.                 Chair all internal/external commercial meetings and keep accurate records of discussions and decisions.                 Provide any and all input into weekly and monthly reporting, both internal and external.                 Identify Risk and Opportunities in conjunction with PMT, register, monitor and report using Risk Platform DANTE.                    JOB REQUIREMENTS                  Specific skills / expertise / product:                     Degree or MBA in one of the following disciplines Business Management, Law, Construction Law, Contract Management, Engineering or Quantity Surveying.                    10+ years experience, preferably in Oil and Gas Offshore industry, in Contract, Commercial or Project Management.                   Strong demonstration of written advocacy.                   Will understand the complexities and have experience in managing a network of contracting requirements and relationships with intricate knowledge of drafting compensation elements.                   Have knowledge and experience of contract drafting and understanding of contract liabilities and indemnities, including for example, extensions of time, change orders, insurance regimes, consequential loss, liquidated damages and capped liabilities.                   Familiarity with corporate structures (including joint ventures).                   Awareness of contractual relationships, for example, concepts such as contract amendments, novations and assignment of contracts.                   Experience in negotiating outcomes and involvement in claims resolution.                   Will have post-Award contract management experience, typically in Lump Sum, Reimbursable and Remeasurable pricing structures.                   Capable of preparing delay and extension of time claims.                   Awareness / Knowledge of HSSE&Q Management Systems / Procedures.                    Experienced user of P6, SharePoint and MS Visio, word, excel and PowerPoint.                    Behaviours & inter-personal skills - Key points                    HSSEQ aware and to be HSSEQ KPI and performance targets conscious.                 Must be a self-leader and work well in a team, but with capability to work alone when required.                 Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.                 Be strategic, forward thinking and an all-inclusive operator when planning and providing solutions.                 Establish and maintain relationship building abilities at all levels.                 Exemplary communication skills and housekeeping mentality (record keeping).                 Sharp stakeholder engagement, capable of summarizing and presenting detailed contractual issues for senior management consultation.                 Fluent in English - written and verbal.                GENERAL INFORMATION         SBM Offshore N.V. is a listed holding company that is headquartered in Amsterdam. It holds direct and indirect interests in other companies that collectively with SBM Offshore N.V. form the SBM Offshore Group ( the Company ). For further information, please visit our website at www.sbmoffshore.com . The companies in which SBM Offshore N.V., directly and indirectly, owns investments are separate entities.       SBM Offshore is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. SBM Offshore does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

column2: The Product Planner   shapes the future direction of Videojet printers by identifying market segments, unmet needs, and competitive opportunities. Responsible for overseeing product launch processes, including concept feasibility and regulatory compliance. Collaborates closely with business unit managers and teams to develop a 5-year roadmap aimed at achieving revenue targets and capturing a larger share of the marking and coding market.    Define long-term product strategy based on market segmentation and customer needs.   Lead the discovery of innovative opportunities by understanding customer challenges and translating them into product enhancements.   Develop and manage the Product and Technology Roadmap for assigned product lines.   Drive the creation of pricing models and market requirements documents.   Facilitate continuous customer validation throughout the product development process.   Oversee initial tollgates in the product launch process, ensuring concept feasibility and regulatory compliance.        KEY STAKEHOLDERS AND PERFORMANCE INDICATORS:      Collaborate closely with global stakeholders and top leadership to align product strategies with company objectives.   Present product vision and strategic insights to the Senior Leadership Team to drive decision-making.   Establish rapport with customers to understand market problems and validate product concepts.   Adapt to changing market dynamics and redirect resources optimally to maximize product impact.   Successful execution of the product roadmap within specified timelines.   Achievement of revenue targets for assigned product lines.   Positive feedback from customers regarding product features and performance.   Effective collaboration with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.        KEY COMPETENCIES       Motivated and Driven:   Demonstrate a strong desire to succeed and the determination to overcome challenges. Your proactive approach and resilience will be key drivers of your success in this role.    Team Player:   Collaborate effectively with colleagues across departments, leveraging collective expertise and resources to deliver exceptional results. Your ability to build strong relationships and work collaboratively will be essential for success in a dynamic team environment.    Market Insight and Analysis  : keen understanding of market dynamics, demonstrated by the ability to conduct comprehensive market research, analyze trends, and identify emerging opportunities and threats. Proficiency in statistical analysis, is essential for effective decision-making and strategy formulation.    Interpersonal and Communication Skills:   The ability to establish strong relationships with customers, stakeholders, and cross-functional teams is crucial. Excellent communication and interviewing skills to accurately grasp customer needs, foster collaboration, and effectively convey product vision and strategic insights to senior leadership.    Strategic Thinking and Flexibility:   Operating in a dynamic environment requires a balance between strategic conviction and flexibility. The Product Planner should exhibit strategic thinking, driving long-term product strategies aligned with market segmentation and customer needs. Additionally, the ability to adapt to changing market dynamics and redirect resources optimally is crucial for maximizing product impact and achieving business objectives.       WE ARE LOOKING FOR A PROFESSIONAL WHO HAS:      Proven Experience in Product Planning and Development:   The ideal candidate should have a track record of success in product planning, development, and launch, preferably within the marking and coding industry or a related field. Experience in overseeing the entire product lifecycle, from conceptualization to commercialization, is highly desirable.    Strong Analytical Skills and Market Research Expertise:   Proficiency in conducting market research, utilizing analytical tools, and interpreting data to drive informed decision-making is essential.    Effective Cross-functional Collaboration:   Excellent interpersonal skills and a collaborative mindset, enabling them to work seamlessly with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and global counterparts. The ability to communicate product vision, gather feedback, and align stakeholders towards common objectives is crucial for success in this role.    Strategic Vision and Adaptability:   Strategic mindset and the ability to envision long-term product strategies aligned with market trends and customer needs. However, flexibility and adaptability are equally important, allowing the candidate to navigate changing market dynamics and adjust strategies as needed to drive business growth and innovation.    Integrity and Professionalism:   Uphold the highest standards of honesty, integrity, and professionalism in all interactions, demonstrating a commitment to ethical conduct and sound business practices.        YOUR EDUCATION AND BACKGROUND EXPERIENCE WILL INCLUDE:       Bachelor s degree in engineering & MBA from a reputable institution (Tier I):   The ideal candidate will possess a Bachelors degree in Engineering complemented by an MBA from a Tier I institution. This educational background provides a strong foundation in both technical and business disciplines, essential for effective product planning and strategic decision-making.    5-7 years of experience in product planning, management, or related roles  : Candidates should have a proven track record of 5-7 years in product planning, preferably in the industrial printing or coding industry. This experience demonstrates a deep understanding of market dynamics, customer needs, and product lifecycle management, essential for success in the role.    Strong Analytical Skills and Market Research Expertise:   The candidate should have demonstrated proficiency in analytics and market research methodologies, enabling them to gather and interpret data effectively. Previous experience in product management roles highlights the candidates ability to leverage market insights to drive strategic decision-making and optimize product offerings. Additionally, excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities are essential for effectively conveying insights and aligning stakeholders towards common objectives.

column2: As a Package Manager within SBM, you have the overall responsibility for the completion (quality, schedule, cost and documentation) of the packages assigned to you. Basically you are the Project Manager of the package as well as the Package Buyer for critical packages. You will need to manage the assigned package from review of engineering documents up to the hand- over to the construction team and, if needed, to assist/ participate in construction/ integration, pre-commissioning and commissioning activities.    In the case of this role, the Package Manager is responsible for EI equipment. You are part of the core team which will handle a proposal, a FEED or an EPC contract. Your experience and expertise on EI is required for most key packages like ICSS, HV, LV equipment, but also field instrumentation, transmitters, flowmeters, level and temperature gauges etc.     RESPONSIBILITIES      Liaise with the Package Engineer (who is responsible for all technical aspects of the package);      Act as the primary focal point for the Vendor on all matters related to the Package;      Liaise with the Group Strategic Sourcing in regards to the Bidder list, benchmarking and problems faced with Vendors. You will approve the Package Bidder list, Commercial Bid Evaluation, Recommendation to Purchase and Purchase Requisition;      Participate in the RFQ preparation, bid- and Vendor qualification;      Define the negotiation strategy with the Buyer, Project Manager and Supply Chain Department Manager;      You will manage the execution of the PO technically and commercially and you make sure the PO execution is in line with the project schedule;      Ensure the Vendor Documents are received , reviewed and approved on time in the Vendor Documentation Management tool;      Receive, control and close the TQs, NCRs, SVRs in liaison with Engineering and PM;      Manage the inspection, the delivery and receipt of the package at site with the help of the Inspection, Expediting and Logistic teams Site Material Controller.       REQUIREMENTS       Bachelor s or Master s degree in relevant field of Engineering     Minimum of 5 years of experience in the Oil Gas, Petrochemical, or similar business in a technical and/or commercial position, preferably in the role as a Package Manager or Engineer.      You possess:     a self- starter who possesses good interpersonal and organizational skills;      a great Time Management skills;      a proactive behavior;      a high capacity to be flexible and adaptable to react to operational changes;      Fluent in English (both written and verbally)      International travel may be required.

column2: Will work within one of the assigned teams based on experience and business need: Project Engineering, Well Completions, Manifold & Interconnect, Drilling & Intervention, or New Product Development.     Job Description      RESPONSIBILITIES:     Works and supports project engineering, new product/technology development, product improvement and product standardization, and product qualification projects depending upon the assigned group.   Develops product design, geometry standards documentation and product qualification requirements.   Creates and reviews part reports, drawings, engineering specifications and standards.   Defines product quality, material, welding, and NDE requirements.   Supports and manage project schedule and deliverables.   Provides Management with technical assistance and work progress updates as requested.   Mentors and provides technical guidance to Engineers and Designers/Drafters. Works collaboratively to accomplish project tasks. Provides independent review of work packages.   Provides vendors technical assistance and builds strong working relationships.   Works to the requirements of industry code related to subsea production systems, TechnipFMC standards and client specifications.   Adheres to all relevant work instructions and design guidelines, Clearly demonstrates creativity and innovation in finding solutions and alternatives.   Develops unique solutions for complex technical problems that may include the design of new products/systems or the development of solutions having few or no precedents.   This is an individual contributor position. The role is responsible for executing activities assigned by the manager, and execute it within the assigned team.     MAIN TASKS:     Supports engineering work packages on a project basis. Ensures that project requirements are captured in engineering deliverables.   Creates and Reviews engineering designs (ie drawings, part reports, specifications, etc) of existing and new technology or projects. Ensures that assignments meet standards and performance requirements within area of expertise.   Actively manages and provides timely updates to engineering schedule, and engineering updates to the project and engineering management team.   Prepares documentation, information, and communications such as ECN (Engineering Change Notices),part reports, and engineering specifications and ensures conformance to all policies and procedures related to engineering functions, labor reporting and systems reporting.   Facilitate RCAs and provide design solutions to correct non-conformances while taking into account safety, quality, schedule, and cost.   Support Quality Notification dispositions and supply chain issues as they arise.   Provides technical support to equipment manufacturing, fabrication, assembly, Factory acceptance test (FAT) and System integration test (SIT) activities.   Works with other engineering teams to ensure good communication of work load requirements and consistent approaches to analytical models and methodologies.   Works with technical authorities in the company to define technical requirements which are appropriate for the products and consistent with industry practices.   Finds creative solutions to multi-faceted and/or time-sensitive, complex problems. Identifies and utilizes available technical resources throughout TechnipFMC and externally.   Consults with other departments on equipment designs. Anticipates potential problems and proactively solves complex problems through creative thinking, using internal and external resources.   Prepares technical data and papers for sales personnel, customers, and publications. Makes presentations to customer management groups.   Actively increases industry knowledge base through technical publications, forums, committee participation, trade shows, etc   Assists engineering manager with any requested technical and engineering related tasks.        REQUIREMENTS  :    Degreed Mechanical Engineer with at least 4-years of Engineering experience in the Oil & Gas domain, reduced to 2-years for Masters/PhD candidates.   Demonstrated experience in supporting engineering for subsea projects constrained by safety, quality, delivery, and cost requirements.   Experience in reviewing engineering designs, documents, layouts, calculations and interpreting FEA/ structural analysis results.   Strong knowledge of engineering discipline and physical modeling techniques (solid mechanics, fluid dynamics, heat transfer) is required. Experience conducting design analysis - hoop stress, flexibility, buckling, burst, fatigue, etc   Work experience must include experience with various ASME, API, NORSOK, and DNV Codes and Standards as it relates to subsea equipment design and manufacturing.   Exposure to various manufacturing processes - forging, hot and cold extrusion, cladding, HIP, induction bending etc   Exposure to welding codes and practices - ASME IX and API 1104.   Exposure to NDE codes and practices - UT, PAUT, PT, RT, MPI per ASME V.   Ability to manage the engineering projects within specified schedule and budget. Demonstrated organization and project planning skills.   Accuracy, dependability, ability to manage schedule and prioritize work.   Ability to work independently and as a part of a technical team - a self-motivated, self-starter.   Ability to make independent system recommendations utilizing advanced analytical and problem solving skills.   Strong written and verbal communication skills in English with ability to effectively transfer subject matter expertise. Ability to coach and mentor others.       WORK ENVIRONMENT:      Spends majority of time in office   Exposed to possible shop or lab hazards including high noise and heavy equipment when in those work area   Some Travel (domestic & international) as necessary visiting TechnipFMC regional offices, plants and makes visits to existing and potential vendor s facilities is required   Must be willing and able to travel on short notice, if issues arise with design and/or within the supply chain         Skills         Leadership Competencies    Act with Agility   Problem Solving   Drive Accountability

column2: Enhance product workflow by researching and developing logistics plans that affect production, distribution, and inventory. Create and review logistics procedures to maximize client satisfaction and minimize cost.       Responsibilities:     Responsible for ensuring productivity, efficiency, and management of various logistics operations.    These operations may include, but are not limited to, tracking product shipments, contract negotiations, preparation of budget and cost analysis statements, creation of more efficient logistical planning, and coordination of shipments.     Recommend improvements to existing or planned logistics processes.    Research for logistics data, using methods such as data mining, data modeling, or cost or benefit research.    Apply investigation methods or tools to comprehend, predict, or control logistics operations or processes.    Interpret data on logistics elements, such as availability, maintainability, reliability, supply chain management, strategic sourcing or distribution, supplier management, or transportation.    Prepare reports on logistics performance measures.    Write or revise standard operating procedures for logistics processes.    Confer with logistics management teams to define ways to optimize service levels, maintain supply-chain efficiency, or minimize cost.    Maintain databases of logistics data and information in accordance with corporate policies.    Provide ongoing researching in areas such as transportation costs, parts procurement, back orders, or delivery processes.    Develop or maintain models for logistics uses, such as cost estimating or demand forecasting.    Monitor industry standards, trends, or practices to identify developments in logistics planning or execution.    Track product flow from origin to final delivery. Monitor flor of vehicles or inventory using logistics systems.    Define packaging requirements.    Compute reporting metrics, such as on-time delivery rates and order fulfillment rates.    Manage systems to ensure that pricing structures adequately reflect logistics costing.    Contact carriers for rates or schedules.    Communicate with or monitor service providers, such as ocean carriers, air freight forwarders, global consolidators, customs brokers, or trucking companies.    Compare locations or environmental policies of carriers or suppliers to make transportation resolutions with lower environmental impact.    Develop or maintain freight rate databases for use by supply chain departments to define the most economical modes of transportation.    Reorganize shipping schedules to consolidate loads, maximize vehicle usage, or limit the movement of empty vehicles or containers.    Develop or maintain payment systems to ensure accuracy of vendor payments.    Route or reroute drivers in real time with remote route navigation software, satellite linkup systems, or global positioning systems (GPS) to improve operational efficiencies.    Enter carbon-output or environmental-impact data into spreadsheets or environmental management or auditing software programs.        Qualifications:      Typically requires a Bachelor s degree in related field or equivalent experience.    Typically requires 3+ years of experience in materials or related field.    A background in manufacturing is desired.

column2: Profile Overview:We are looking for an experienced professional in the FLYASH Thermal sector, who will oversee and manage business operations at the assigned Thermal power plant by setting up the entire operations team for flyash disposal. Job DescriptionResponsible for setting up the entire operations team.Assisting and overseeing the site engaged in disposing ash from Thermal power for both fly and legacy ash disposal as per the margins agreed by the management.Monitor the work progress on a regular basis and formulate reports as required (daily, weekly monthly, yearly planning etc)Arranging local transporters from power plants to mines/low-lying areas and ensuring that the vehicles run as per expectations. Maintain diesel stores and track the usage of diesel on a regular basis. Ensure that there is no theft.Helping the subcontractors with gate passes and weighbridge processes.Assisting the team in engaging and monitoring the quantum of bulkers from cement plants and brick plants to enhance the sale/disposal of Silo Ash.Manage good relationships with cement companies and mine owners for their short-term and long-term business needs. Engage with all the sub-contractors and manage the driver requirements.Coordinate with thermal power plants and ensure engagement by maintaining rapport and relationships for further business.Assisting the team in managing all administrative activities and official activities thereby maintaining safe disposal of ash disposalAssisting the team in building the operational team.Need to assist the management or head with any other possible new business opportunities in current locations.Desired ProfileAny graduate with 10 to 20 years of experience in FLY ash disposal and management.Should have good understating of transportation and fleet management.Should handle a team of 15 to 20 supervisorsAbility to handle the work load and multiple truipsShould have a good understanding of managing the ash business and logistics.Should have good negotiation and organizational skills

column2: As Supplier Quality Engineer for Mechanical System and Large Steel Fabrications, you will conduct supplier qualification, development and quality assurance measures    You will be working and close networking with multi-cultural environment with different departments locally and globally   Closely collaborating with the global SCM process   SQE is using digitalization tools to improve our processes   SQE is addressing nonconformance with conducting containment, RCA, and implementing preventative measures risk mitigation measures          How You ll Make an Impact         Supplier Qualification: Support a multi-functional team by assessing supplier capabilities, auditing supplier quality management system processes, etc     Product and Process Qualification: Lead or support multi-functional teams to perform Product and Process Qualification (PPQ) on commodity parts and systems according to applicable process descriptions and standards. Leading includes the planning, tracking, and reporting of project landmarks as well as budget and resource needs.     Support the supplier quality assurance measures along the complete PPQ. Approve supplier process via submitted Manufacturing Quality Control Plan.     Perform source / virtual / desk inspection of suppliers of components and systems in the area of responsibility.     Coordinate nonconformance processing at the supplier and ensure appropriate actions are taken to prevent recurrence.     Monitor supplier Key Performance Indicators and adjust quality, inspection, and development planning activities accordingly.     Facilitate recurring supplier qualification development status meetings. Ensure qualifications are on track and potentials risks are identified.     Work with various Supplier Quality Development tools and databases. Ensure data quality and transparency.       What You Bring         Bachelor s or master s degree or equivalent experience in mechanical, industrial engineering, or a similar field. Equivalent combination of education, training, and experience will be considered.     Technical experience with industrial process technology and /or auxiliary systems in energy generation plants (enclosures, steel structures, piping, pressure vessels, skids, etc)     Knowledge in welding and coating, familiar with respective ISO ASME code requirements (eg ISO-3834, AWS D1.1)     Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.     Familiarity with root cause analysis and other quality risk management methodologies     10 + years experience in technical field and/or working in Supply Chain     Open minded, results solution oriented and good analytical thinking. Advanced Communication/Presentation skills, basic Commercial Knowledge.     Project Management Experience preferred.     Willingness to travel ~50%

column2: This is a full-time hybrid role for a Associate Manager- Business Development at Plastics For Change located in Bengaluru, with flexibility for remote work. As a Associate Manager- Business Development, you will be responsible for developing and overseeing the verified ethical sourcing platform that connects waste collectors, MRFs, scarp shops, Recycler and global brands. This includes collaborating with various government agencies, stakeholders and cross-functional teams. Also responsible for implementing supply chain best practices and designing sourcing methodologies, executing end-to-end logistics and product processes, and expanding the network of ethical suppliers.   Duties & Key Responsibilities     Familiarizing with all products and services offered by the company.     Should have a good understanding of the businesses' products or services and be able to advise others about them.     Market Analysis - Conduct market research to identify potential clients, industries, and regions for material. Analyze market trends, competitor activities, and regulatory changes.     Client Acquisition - Develop and implement strategies to acquire new clients and business opportunities.     Identifying opportunities for new business development through following up on leads and conducting research on target clients     Procuring new clients through direct contact, word-of-mouth, and collaboration with the marketing department.     Client Relationship Management - Build and maintain strong relationships with existing clients and address client inquiries, concerns, and feedback. Maintaining meaningful relationships with existing clients to ensure that they are retained.     New business generation by meeting potential clients to understand needs and providing relevant solutions     Understanding client needs and offering solutions and support.     Negotiation and Closure- Negotiate terms, conditions, and pricing with clients.     Creating and maintaining a list/database of prospect clients, maintaining a database (Salesforce, CRM, Excel, etc.) of prospective client information     Cross-Functional Collaboration- Collaborate with internal teams, including operations, logistics, and finance, to ensure seamless service delivery. Coordinate with relevant departments for project implementation.     Responsible for market studies for sourcing of raw materials (Plastics like HDPE, LDPE, PP etc)     Compliance and Regulations - Stay informed about waste management regulations and compliance requirements and ensure that the company s services adhere to environmental standards.     Should meet the expectation in terms of individual target and company s goal.      Team Leadership and Training - Provide guidance and leadership to junior team members, if applicable. Conduct training sessions on product knowledge and sales techniques.     Attending networking activities to research and connect with prospective clients.     SKILLS, KN  OWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS     Qualification Graduate/Post Graduate     Experience 5+ years of experience in the related field.    General responsibilities     Ensure professionalism at all times and demonstrate exemplary prioritisation of workload skills.     Ensure that the PFC policies, SOPs, and protocols are being adhered to at all levels of the company.     Ensure strict adherence to data confidentiality and security.     Willingness to travel across Bengaluru city, including other places as per need of project or company.     Work closely with the PFC team and Partners.

column1: Supply Chain Strategy and Optimization Analyst
column2: If you are a strategic thinker and a Supply Chain professional with a passion for transforming Supply Chain for the future, this could be your chance to make your mark in the Lubricant business.Where you fitShell is actively working towards establishing a more extensive presence in the Lubricants Supply Chain, with plans for significant scaling in the upcoming years. The Lubricants business, recognizing the pivotal role of its supply chain, is committed to turning it into a competitive advantage. The Lubricant Supply Chain (LSC) organization, as an integral part of the broader Lubricants business, is crucial for achieving success in the marketplace.As part of the Lubricants Americas Supply Chain Optimization and Projects organization, you drive world class Sales and Operations Planning for North and South America lubricant supply chain network across multiple sales channels (B2B, B2C, Indirect, Retail). The broad product portfolio includes fast-moving consumer goods, products exclusively developed for key customers, and specialty products with niche applications.Whats the role?As Supply Chain Strategy and Optimization Analyst, you support Lubricants Americas in delivering its growth ambitions. Lubricants Americas is within the Shell Global Lubricants portfolio-- A business advancing towards an accelerated growth commitment by 2025 with a 10% CAGR.Further accountabilities are as follows:Work across sectors and lines of businesses to identify pain points/constraints/value leakage, to drive gap closure initiatives.Work with Shell owned and third-party assets to identify operational challenges and constraints to drive resolution and to increase customer satisfaction.Supporting the S&OP process by ensuring sufficient e2e capacity in network to support demand from raw materials to production to logistics.Determining optimal customer and production sourcing by evaluating feasibility, capacity, cost, working capital, and customer satisfaction trade-offs.Optimizing the supply chain footprint by identifying opportunities ranging from optimization of constraint resources, economic order quantity, etc.Work with sales and marketing to rationalize portfolio to reduce complexity and increase overall lubricants Americas profitability.Work collectively across lubricants to ensure profitability targets are metFor Portfolio/COGS Supply Chain Strategy & Optimization, you are responsible toWork with Sales and Marketing across the various sectors to understand their specific needs and develop an end-to-end strategy to support those sectors.Work with a specific sector to define winning portfolio and associated portfolio metrics, e.g., % tail, ROACE, profitability, customer satisfaction etc. Develop outlets for slow moving (tail) products to minimize value loss.Drive initiatives with Sales & Marketing and Product Management to develop a view of customer wants vs needs to maximize profitability.Look to optimize product component cost and develop product supply security optionality to enable business goals.Work with sales and marketing to rationalize portfolio to reduce complexity and increase overall lubricants Americas profitability.Work collectively across lubricants to ensure profitability targets are met.What we need from youBachelor's degree in supply chain management, engineering, or a related field6+ years of experience in supply chain optimization, preferably in a manufacturing or logistics environment (in FMCG environment)Prior experience in the S&OP process/managing product portfolio.Experience with data analysis and visualization tools such as Tableau, Excel, Power BI, Spotfire, Alteryx.Excellent communication and interpersonal skillsStrong project management skills, including the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.Experience in SAP or other Supply Planning tools and/or Supply Chain planning software is a plus.Prior Lubricants experience is a plus.Willingness to work during US hours (Houston) with some flexibility. The role will be based out of India to support the lubricants business in the North America. Shift allowance (as per India country norms) will be provided for the off-shift requirement in addition to the regular salary.
