column1: IT Service and Change Manager - Procurement
column2: Your role as an IT Service and Change Manager - Procurement is to support the implementation of our digitalization projects    You will be contributing through ensuring smooth utilization and release implementation of digital solutions specially SAP End to End (E2E) Ariba implementation project    You will work and co-ordinate with Global business users related to resolving Incidents and implementing Change requests related to Procurement in SAP E2E Ariba project    You will coordinate and work with the appropriate IT development and middleware Teams to find a solution that meets the agreed operation Level Agreement and fix it within the agreed Service Level Agreement    Besides that, you will coordinate and plan the Testing for the application and join the related meetings to understand and keep up with the ongoing developments    Work closely with stakeholders, expand your network and prepare yourself for future global roles at Siemens Energy        How You ll Make an Impact     Our team is actively supporting the Siemens Energy Digital Transformation, a global digitization initiative launched to optimize the functionality of Siemens Energy Supply Chain Management.    We are looking for a driven, self-motivated individual with excellent service orientation and skills/experience in operational procurement to support the implementation of our digitalization projects.     Service, Change Management / Coordinator for End-to-End Procurement, translator and coordinator between business and Tech team.    Coordinate with Incident, Problem, Configuration managers to share information or coordinate action on emergency Change Requests    To plan, elaborate, design and maintenance of assigned tasks /action list (IT focus)    Development and controlling of time schedule together with Project Leads    Controlling of implementation progress and execution of IT relevant testing    Status reporting to related stakeholders    Ensure business acceptance of handed over solution results.    Ensure knowledge transfer from SAP to own responsibility of implemented functions and smooth handover to stable operations.    Review the Change Request documentation (process, work instructions, best practices)    Challenge requirements against standards and harmonized processes    Openness for Hands-on work assigned to check, review and activate/customize the new features released by SAP.      What You Bring      You should be 6 - demonstrated ability IT professional with Graduation in Engineering or equivalent.    Having hands on experience of SAP Ariba or S4 HANA Central Procurement    Having experience of SCM Procurement Processes (source-to-contract /requisition-to-order)    Having experience of Project and Service Management, ITIL / Operations Management    Having good knowledge of ITSM Service Now, Jira, Change and Request modules is an advantage.    Having hands on experience of Requirement engineering / translator (business - IT service provider)    Having hands on experience in Stakeholder Management.      Rewards/Benefits      Under our motto #BetterTogether, we offer our employees the opportunity to work flexibly and remotely. But our offices also leave nothing to be desired and offer space for inspiring collaboration and creativity.    Our people are our most valuable asset. We in Siemens Energy care for your good health & wellbeing. Accordingly, we offer Home Collection based Preventive Health Check-up to our employees and their family .    The professional and personal development of our employees is very important to us. We give them the opportunity to learn and develop in a self-determined way. Various attractive programmes and measures are available for this purpose.    Flexi Pay empowers employees with the choice to customize the amount in some of the salary components within a defined range thereby optimizing the tax benefits. column2: The Supply Chain Transformation Business Program Manager will be working with different internal cross functional business teams in Nextracker as well as some of the Business Systems, and Implementation Partner teams   As a Business Program Manager at Nextracker, you will drive the day-to-day program management for supply chain Business stakeholders focused on Process and System Improvement initiatives for internal and external stakeholders   You will be part of the Supply Chain Transformation team who is responsible to drive strategic initiatives aimed at enhancing operational efficiency, improving customer experiences, and driving innovation across Supply Chain Business Function   Responsibilities include delivering programs on time, within budget and scope, holding all team members accountable, escalating when necessary and ensuring critical stakeholders are informed and aligned       You would love this job if   :    You love to help build global scalable disruptive Supply Chain System solutions.   You find value in collaborating with teams building System solutions that empowers the business stakeholders / Leaders to make critical decisions using Systems and Data insights.   When the team is presented with complex business challenges you can bring together all key stakeholders involved to envision an end-to-end solution.   Due to the nature of the role and reporting visibility you are very attentive to detail and presentation   You have the ability to partner and build trust with different teams across the company     We are looking for someone who demonstrates:     Intense collaboration   Passionate customer focus   Thoughtful, fast, disciplined execution   Tenacious commitment to continuous improvement   Relentless drive to deliver value to Internal and External stakeholders     Here is a glimpse of what you'll do:       Develop and standardize business process and digital capability to track portfolio performance of all transformation initiatives ensuring success through measurement of critical milestones and committed benefits   Develop project scopes, detailed project plan to track progress and objectives   Manage internal Business stakeholders to deliver projects on time   Establish program management best practices   Perform structured risk management and escalate to management as needed   Ensure that quality, risks, issues, and lessons are reported in a timely manner, controlled, and mitigated   Regularly report the status of all programs, progress vs. plan, risks issues to internal business stakeholder per communication plan   Maintain relationships and communication with all key stakeholders- set and manage customer expectations throughout the project lifecycle   Direct program team members as required to deliver the project plan. Manage program team of up-to 20 team members including product owners, Data Stewards, business owners         Here is some of what you'll need   :    At least 10 years of overall experience in Program Management of Business Transformation initiatives. Relevant experience working on solutions in Supply Chain Domain.   Strong Business Acumen with some form of Domain experience in in Supply chain function (Domain Knowledge for Planning, Procurement, Logistics processes)   Experience of min 2 end to end Supply Chain Business Systems implementation Projects   Experience in dealing with complex business process and systems/software programs   Understanding of the importance of change management, adoption, and value capture   Well versed in Microsoft tools and other applications critical for program management execution   Excellent organization, collaboration, and communication skills   Detailed oriented for execution while thinking and leading at the strategic level   Experience building and managing reports   Knowledge / Experience in Agile Project Management   Team player who is organized and detail oriented

column2: As a   Software Support Config Validator  , you are the customer s hero in time of need! A customer s advocate internally and an Esko advocate externally, you stand by our customers when they are in need of upgrades, licenses and other support related requirements, ensuring an effortless software support experience.   If you are looking for an opportunity to help colleagues and customers to grow, with access to some of the most experienced packaging industry experts in your own team, then being part of our Esko software experts could be right up your street. We want you to feel part of a brilliant team and a caring organization that values your ideas and input       THIS JOB IS A UNIQUE OPPORTUNITY:        Our Software Support Config Validators are an essential part of keeping our customers up and running with our solutions, with their passion and know-how of Esko process and procedures   You will come across situation where customers are looking forward for support on software issues, upgrade licenses, upgrade installation needs and other support tasks which might be on chargeable basis and you bridge this gap by taking care of this part                  WITHIN YOUR ROLE, YOU WILL:     Be the face and voice of the customer within Esko   The first point of contact when they call for support.   Keep the customer informed and updated as you progress in their requests.   Learn and plug into the latest trends, policies and procedures.   Be part of a customer-centric team of experts, looking after Subject Matter Experts to enterprise customers   React to issues and proactively anticipate customer challenges   Build a trusted partnership with the customer   Help the customer to continuously get the best value they can from the software.   Work on providing them with the required upgrade licenses by thoroughly checking their configuration.   Take the ownership when customers report emergency issues related to licenses.   Cater to the needs of the support organization when they are in need of a temp license to help our customers.   Receive incoming support calls from customers, understand the requirement, prioritize and take actions to address the concerns by working as a team with engineer in a timely manner.   Do the math, and provide our esteemed customers a proposal on services which will be on chargeable basis.       WE ARE LOOKING FOR A PROFESSIONAL WHO IS:       Good communicator (phone, email, chat)   Has basic commercial knowledge   Empathy for other people (colleagues and customers!)   Proactive to the problem at hand, as well as challenging how we eliminate problems in future!   Excellent listening skills and ability to understand and interpret customer needs and manage customer expectations.   Fluency in English   OK to work in shifts as this is a 24/7 support organization. The shift timings are as follows:    First Shift: 06:30AM to 03:30PM IST   Second Shift: 02:30PM to 11:30PM IST   Night Shift: 10:30PM to 07:30AM IST (next day)     Willing to work on weekends. As this is a 24/7 support organization, you might get scheduled to work on Saturday AND/OR Sundays. But this will be considered as your workday, and you can take any other two days as your Week-off based on the planning of schedule by your team leader.   Willing to work in hybrid mode.       YOUR EDUCATION AND BACKGROUND EXPERIENCE WILL INCLUDE:        Experience in problem solving, and a quick learner.   Analytical mindset, with a calm, methodical approach to problem solving.   Direct experience of handling customer communication.   Has fair idea of Esko softwares (Automation Engine, Imaging Engine, PackProof, ArtiosCAD, ArtPro, ArtPro+, PackEdge, Plato, Cape, DeskPack, i-Cut, Studio, VDP).   AND/OR formal qualification in Printing Technology

column2: ?   The Buyer is responsible to source, negotiate and purchase equipment/services in line with budget, schedule, quality and technical project requirements while ensuring that any procurement activity complies with Group Supply Chain strategy processes.      RESPONSIBILITIES      Lead the tender process in a fair manner and identify Bidders that will best meet SBM s technical requirements, budget and schedule constrains. Understand the contractual requirements of equipment/service to be purchased and elaborate the bid package together with the relevant disciplines (Eng, Legal, etc)      Ensure that Vendor Qualification process is performed as per SBM rules      Issue Request For Quotation, expedite and collect offers from Bidders      Analyze the offers and identify areas for commercial or contractual clarifications in order to facilitate discussion with Bidders and get offers aligned and in line with SBM requirements      Develop recommendations for the Bidder selection based on the input from the relevant disciplines and on the assessment of offered costs, technical requirements and delivery time in accordance with SBM Ethics and Compliance rules (eg competition rules )      Fully document the tendering process (ie Commercial Bid Evaluation, Recommendation To Purchase )      Ensure that the tactical management of the procurement process (from RFQ preparation till Recommendation To Purchase) is conducted appropriately and in full compliance with SBM Working Procedures. column2: The Stores Executive is responsible for managing and overseeing the day-to-day operations of the companys warehouse and inventory management. This role involves efficiently managing the receipt, storage, distribution, and tracking of materials and products to ensure seamless production processes and timely deliveries.    Key Responsibilities:    1. **Inventory Management:**  - Receive, inspect, and record incoming materials and products.  - Maintain accurate inventory records and update systems regularly.  - Monitor stock levels and initiate replenishment orders when necessary.  - Conduct regular stock audits to ensure inventory accuracy.   2. **Warehousing Operations:**  - Organize and optimize warehouse layout to maximize space utilization.  - Ensure proper storage and handling of materials to prevent damage.  - Oversee the picking, packing, and dispatching of orders to production or customers.  - Implement safety and security measures within the warehouse.   3. **Order Fulfillment:**  - Collaborate with production and procurement teams to fulfill material requirements.  - Ensure timely availability of materials to support production schedules.  - Prepare materials for outbound shipments and coordinate with logistics partners.   4. **Vendor Coordination:**  - Communicate with suppliers for order confirmations, delivery schedules, and discrepancies.  - Handle return or replacement of defective or non-conforming materials.  - Maintain positive relationships with vendors and negotiate favorable terms.   5. **Documentation:**  - Generate and maintain documentation related to incoming and outgoing materials.  - Prepare accurate reports on inventory levels, stock movement, and consumption.  - Ensure compliance with relevant documentation and regulatory requirements.   6. **Quality Control:**  - Perform regular quality checks on incoming and stored materials.  - Identify and report any quality issues or deviations to the relevant teams.   7. **Process Improvement:**  - Identify opportunities to streamline processes and improve operational efficiency.  - Implement best practices for inventory management and warehouse operations.   8. **Team Collaboration:**  - Collaborate with cross-functional teams including procurement, production, and logistics.  - Provide guidance and support to warehouse staff, ensuring a productive work environment.    Qualifications and Skills:    - Bachelors degree / Diploma in Business Administration, Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Engineering or a related field.  - Proven experience 2 years in warehouse and inventory management within an industrial manufacturing environment.  - Strong knowledge of inventory management software and tools.  - Familiarity with safety and quality standards in warehousing.  - Excellent organizational and multitasking skills.  - Attention to detail and accuracy in record-keeping.  - Effective communication and interpersonal skills.  - Ability to work independently and as part of a team.  - Problem-solving skills to address challenges related to inventory and logistics.  - Proficiency in using Microsoft Office suite (Excel, Word, etc.).
column13: Procurement, Business administration, Outbound, Supply chain management, Process improvement, Packaging, Manager Quality Control, Operations, Warehouse operations, Logistics

column2: This position is responsible for driving Imports procurement processes to ensure timely availability of product to meet the customer demand & organization plan of revenue, freight, and inventory. The position will be responsible to efficiently manage the on-time delivery leading indicators such as Supplier On-time delivery, On-time arrival, by working in close partnership with various partners such as Supplier, Freight Forwarder, Customs agents, Sales, Customer Service & Warehouse. The position will also provide real time visibility and analytical support to aide quick decision making to achieve the goal of customer satisfaction & business profitability.        Primary Responsibilities:      Execute import procurement strategies to ensure timely and cost-effective sourcing of goods.   Monitor supplier performance, resolve issues, and maintain strong relationships to ensure continuity of the supply chain.   Stay updated with import regulations, tariffs, duties, and trade agreements to ensure compliance and minimize risks.   Collaborate with internal stakeholders such as Supplier, Freight forwarder, Customs agents, logistics, Customer service and finance to optimize procurement processes and meet business objectives.   Manage import documentation, including customs clearance, shipping documents, and permits, to facilitate smooth import operations.   Maintain record of all key communications including but not limited to customs to help future audit queries.   Maintain updated copies of Rate contract / pricing agreement with Supplier, Freight forwarders, Customs agents for ready reference from time to time.   Help maintain & analyse procurement data, track key performance indicators, and prepare reports to assess performance and identify areas for improvement.   Stay abreast of industry best practices, technological advancements, and innovations in import procurement.   Timely ordering of material requirements as per demand / forecast to meet revenue & On-time delivery targets.   Facilitate Daily Management activities related to Imports procurement.   Address supply chain issues by communicating, escalating, and coordinating with various stakeholders for resolution.   Submit regular & periodic update to the supply chain leadership team.   Work with multiple vendors to determine the best deals for the company and evaluate pros and cons of each, based on price, quality, speed of delivery and other factors.   Should be able to gather information to aid quick decision making.   Demonstrate Basic math skills to analyse prices and get the best deals possible.   Use good Negotiation skills to work with suppliers to create the best deals.       Knowledge, Skills      Education - Bachelor s degree/ Management diploma / degree in Supply chain / Operations / Logistics is an added advantage.   Work experience - Minimum of 3-5 years of supply chain / logistics in an Indian or a multi-national company.   Excellent competency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint   Excellent negotiation, communication, and interpersonal skills   Must have good communication skills & proficiency in English, Hindi   Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.   Attention to detail and strong problem-solving skills.   Certification in procurement or supply chain management is a plus.

column2: As Supply Chain Support Manager, you are responsible for developing and maintaining the team skill sets. You are responsible for allocating resources to ensure that supply chain activities are completed as per schedule, quality and safety requirements.   You take ownership of the overall quality and performance of the work delivered by your team and you are responsible for the overall department budget.   You also take ownership of all activities within your perimeter in accordance with company procedures and governance.   In your role, you must provide guidance to the team in order that supply chain activities are properly executed and risk is mitigated to prevent potential impact on the overall project/operations.   Below contribution requires expertise for your designated scope (procurement, package management, expediting, inspection, logistics, material control).    ROLE CONTRIBUTION  1. In order that proper resources are allocated to all project / operations, you are to :  1.1. Develop a staffing plan by coordinating with the project / operations management to define the manpower requirements and provide qualified resources  1.2. Manage staffing plan to suit current and future workload needs and proactively resolve any resource gaps through effective networking with other departments, other location s or third party sub-contractors whenever necessary;  1.3. Ensure proper lines of communication for resources alignment and project /operations priorities  The measure of your effectiveness in this will be:  Accuracy of manpower planning  Positive feedback from project /operations management team  2. In order to ensure staff is adequately skilled to achieve deliverables, you are to :  2.1. Understand and manage project / operations requirements of staff capabilities  2.2. Ensure team is provided with career opportunities and proper training in relevant areas aligned with current and future business needs  2.3. Provide coaching and mentoring to staff, implement development action plans and ensure a highly motivated working environment  2.4. Proactively address team performance issues and partner with HR as necessary to reach the expected level of performance  2.5. Promote the development of internal tools  The measure of your effectiveness in this will be:  Evidence of staff development based on applicable competencies  Turn over within the team  ROLE PROFILE  SUPPLY CHAIN SUPPORT MANAGER PAGE 3 of 4  3. In order to ensure quality of all supply chain deliverables in line with Company standards, international and local regulations, you are to :  3.1. Explain and enforce all Working Procedures related to procurement, package management, expediting, inspection, logistics, material control  3.2. Cascade and explain all deliverables provided by Strategic Sourcing and get them implemented at best (Group Framework Agreements (GFA), Approved Vendor Lists, benchmark, market analysis, vendor action plans )  3.3. Apply all relevant Company Ethics and Compliance procedures (eg anticorruption, bribery)  3.4. Apply all relevant Quality Regulatory Management procedures  3.5. Supervise the procedures and ensure compliance to international and local regulations  3.6. For project activities, be involved at the early phase to ensure realistic KPIs are set (quality, quantity schedule, costs)   The measure of your effectiveness in this will be:    Number of reported breaches of procedure   Number of quality issues on equipment   Demonstrated actions to monitor team performance

column2: Redaptive is seeking a dedicated, detail-oriented and organized Sales Operations Manager to join our team in Pune, India    As a Sales Operations Manager at Redaptive, you will play a pivotal role in our companys operations, contributing to our growth and success    This role will be report to Redaptive s global Sales Operations team    Your ability to manage forecasting, sales process optimization, contracts, orders, and cases efficiently while fostering collaboration with various teams will be essential in ensuring our operations run smoothly    The ideal candidate is dynamic, growth-oriented and multifaceted, requiring a blend of analytical skills, business acumen, deep understanding of contract & order management, action-oriented and able to manage deliverables effectively    If you thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we invite you to join our team and make a significant impact in a growing organization        Job Responsibilities      Sales Process Optimization:      Develop and optimize sales processes and workflows to enhance efficiency and effectiveness, ensuring alignment with company objectives.      Sales Forecasting, Territory & Quota Management:      Assist in the development of sales forecasts, setting achievable targets, and monitoring progress towards goals.    Assist in the preparation of reports and other materials as needed regarding pipeline, forecasts, and revenue.      CRM Management:      Oversee the utilization, customization, and optimization of CRM tools (eg, Salesforce, Clari) to improve sales team productivity and data accuracy.      Contract Management:      Thoroughly review, comprehend, and manage the specifics of contracts to ensure accuracy, compliance, and legal validity.    Process and manage sales orders efficiently in Salesforce.    Coordinate administrative tasks, such as maintaining accurate & up-to-date records of orders, contracts, and related documents.    Implement and enforce best practices for contract and order management.    Coordinate & resolve any billing transactions with internal partners & with external customers in coordination with the Manager of Sales Operations.      Cross-functional Collaboration:      Work closely with Finance, Business Intelligence, Marketing, and Operations teams to ensure alignment and collaboration on sales strategies, targets, and initiatives.    Performing ad-hoc requests from various business units across the organization.    Expectation on working hours will be 3 PM-11 PM IST to align with USA mornings.      Job Requirements/ Qualifications      7+ years experience in sales operations domain.    Salesforce proficiency - A deep understanding of Salesforce features (specifically Sales Cloud), functionalities, and navigation is essential. This includes the ability to work with Salesforce Lightning, data entry and consistency.    Prior experience in sales forecasting, process optimization, and sales enablement initiatives.    Excellent analytical skills with a demonstrated ability to interpret sales performance metrics and generate actionable insights.    Strategic thinking and problem-solving abilities to identify process gaps and implement effective solutions.    Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines.    Strong project management skills with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.    Detail oriented and hyper organized    Background in contract law or legal studies can be beneficial for contract management and compliance.    Competence in managing & maintaining accuracy and precision in managing orders, contracts, and cases is crucial to avoid errors and discrepancies.    Eagerness to learn about and work with teams across all areas of the business and an interest in energy and the environment.    Strong written and verbal communication skills to liaise with sales teams, customers, and other stakeholders and to create exceptional and clean internal documentation.    Experience using Microsoft based systems (Office, Word, Excel, PowerPoint), SharePoint, Salesforce, and Asana.       Nice-to-Have Skills       Experience working with Clari for pipeline management, sales forecasting, and revenue tracking.    Experience working with energy efficiency systems (eg, lighting, solar, HVAC, electric vehicle charging, etc) is a plus.    Experience within new-age organizations.       Behavioral Attributes       Exceptional customer-centric mindset and demonstrated ability to earn trust and partner with teams to deliver results.    Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.    Highly organized and able to prioritize and execute multiple tasks against tight timelines.    Exceptional communication, and organizational skills.

Strategic Planning and Business Development:- Develop and implement strategic plans to expand the company's presence in the solar energy sector.- Identify new business opportunities, partnerships, and market trends to drive growth and revenue generation.- Conduct comprehensive market studies and analysis to assess market demand, competition, and potential areas for expansion.2. Project Management and Execution:- Lead project planning, execution, and delivery for solar energy projects ranging from 1KW to 1MW capacity.- Oversee all aspects of project lifecycle, including site assessment, engineering design, procurement, construction, installation, and commissioning.- Ensure adherence to project timelines, budgets, quality standards, and regulatory requirements.- Manage project risks, resolve issues, and implement mitigation strategies to ensure project success.3. Procurement and Supply Chain Management:- Oversee procurement activities, including vendor selection, contract negotiation, and material sourcing for solar projects.- Manage relationships with suppliers, subcontractors, and partners to ensure timely delivery of materials and services.- Optimize supply chain processes to minimize costs, reduce lead times, and improve project efficiency.5. column2: As an Inspection Coordinator within SBM, you have the responsibility to oversee and manage supplier s quality assurance of the equipment and commodities purchased by SBM. Additionally, you may be required to perform surveillance of the supplier's operations, evaluation of the effectiveness of the suppliers quality system implementation, and inspection at the supplier shop.                   ?         Your specific tasks will include:                Arranging for Supplier Plant Surveys when requested by the Project Procurement Manager.                  Arranging for evaluation of a suppliers Quality System.                  Coordinating quality-related supplier matters with clients and others.                  Participating in bid clarification and supplier pre-inspection meetings as required.                  Review and approval of vendor s QAP and ITP in conjunction with engineering.                  Preparing and issuing Inspection Assignment Instructions to TPI agencies                  Review and distribution of the inspection reports received from TPI agencies                  Communicating nonconformities (NCRs) to the project team members, and verifying corrective action and NCR resolution.                  Issuing releases for shipment of acceptable products.                  Coordinate with construction for resolution of supplier-related site issued quality observations                 In the case of this includes performing the inspection at supplier shop, then the inspection coordinator will also be:                Performing Evaluations of a Supplier Quality System as requested.                  Performing Supplier Plant Surveys.                  Monitoring and reporting on the effectiveness of the Suppliers quality system.                  Verifying materials (MTRs, Material Identification, etc).                  Performing surveillance of manufacturing operations (forming, welding, finishes, etc).                  Witnessing nondestructive examinations/testing and reviewing results.                  REQUIREMENTS                 bachelors or masters degree in the relevant field of Engineering and minimum of 8 to 10 years of experience in the Oil Gas, Petrochemical, or similar business in quality-related position.                  Knowledge of applicable specifications, codes, and standards typical in the Oil and Gas industry                  Proven experience in managing inspection activities in local and global supplier shops                  Leadership skills and proactive behavior;                  Problem solver and ability to foresee quality issues in advance                  Willingness to travel and flexible/adaptable                  Good communication skills (both written and verbal)

column2: Role holder is responsible for managing the execution of projects within the assigned program portfolio. It requires close coordination with cross-functional teams to define project scope, objectives, and deliverables, while ensuring adherence to budget, timelines, and quality standards.    Timely product launch using Open Innovation.   Navigate OI tollgates ensuring market readiness achieved.   Strong technical acumen on key technologies.   Partner/Supplier/Alliance selection, evaluation, onboarding.       KEY STAKEHOLDERS AND PERFORMANCE INDICATORS:     Cross-functional collaboration driving team competence development and project success.   Influence team for seamless product launches and business unit growth.   OI product launches on time and on spec.   Performance of launched OI products on revenue and profitability.        KEY COMPETENCIES       Motivated and Driven:   Demonstrate a strong desire to succeed and the determination to overcome challenges. Your proactive approach and resilience will be key drivers of your success in this role.    Team Player:   Collaborate effectively with colleagues across departments, leveraging collective expertise and resources to deliver exceptional results. Your ability to build strong relationships and work collaboratively will be essential for success in a dynamic team environment.    Interpersonal and Communication Skills:   The ability to establish strong relationships with customers, stakeholders, and cross-functional teams is crucial. Excellent communication and interviewing skills to accurately grasp customer needs, foster collaboration, and effectively convey product vision and strategic insights to senior leadership.    Effective Project Management:   Proficient in project management methodologies and techniques, with the ability to plan, execute, and monitor projects within the assigned program portfolio. Demonstrated experience in navigating complex project environments and overcoming obstacles to ensure successful project delivery.    Attention to Detail:   Possess a keen eye for detail and a meticulous approach to project execution, ensuring that all aspects of the project are thoroughly reviewed and addressed. Ability to identify potential risks and issues early on and implement proactive measures to mitigate them, thereby ensuring high-quality project outcomes.       WE ARE LOOKING FOR A PROFESSIONAL WHO HAS:      Proven Experience in Program Management:   The ideal candidate should possess a strong track record of success in program management for new product development (NPD), particularly in the context of open innovation initiatives. Experience in overseeing the execution of multiple projects within a program portfolio, from initiation to delivery, is highly desirable.    Leadership Skills:   Demonstrated ability to provide direction and to the cross-functional teams, driving alignment with organizational goals and objectives. The candidate should have the capability to translate business strategies into actionable project plans, ensuring the successful execution and delivery of projects.    Effective Stakeholder Engagement:   Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, enabling the candidate to engage effectively with stakeholders at all levels, including senior management, cross-functional teams, partners, suppliers, and alliances. The candidate should have the ability to influence and negotiate to ensure project success and foster collaborative relationships.    Integrity and Professionalism:   Uphold the highest standards of honesty, integrity, and professionalism in all interactions, demonstrating a commitment to ethical conduct and sound business practices.       YOUR EDUCATION AND BACKGROUND EXPERIENCE WILL INCLUDE:     Bachelor s degree in Engineering and MBA: The ideal candidate will possess a Bachelors degree in Engineering coupled with an MBA from an institution. This educational background equips the candidate with a solid foundation in both technical and business disciplines, essential for effective program management and decision-making in product development initiatives.   12-14 years of experience in Program Management: Candidates should have an experience in program management roles, particularly in the context of new product development (NPD) and open innovation initiatives.   Proven Track Record in Driving Project Success: The candidate should demonstrate a successful track record of driving project success, including on-time delivery, within budget, and meeting quality standards. Experience in managing cross-functional teams and navigating project environments is essential.

column2: As a Package Manager within SBM, you have the overall responsibility for the completion (quality, schedule, cost and documentation) of the packages assigned to you. Basically you are the Project Manager of the package as well as the Package Buyer for critical packages. You will need to manage the assigned package from review of engineering documents up to the hand- over to the construction team and, if needed, to assist/ participate in construction/ integration, pre-commissioning and commissioning activities.      In the case of this role, the Package Manager is responsible for mechanical equipment.         RESPONSIBILITIES         Liaise with the Package Engineer (who is responsible for all technical aspects of the package);      Act as the primary focal point for the Vendor on all matters related to the Package;      Liaise with the Group Strategic Sourcing in regards to the Bidder list, benchmarking and problems faced with Vendors. You will approve the Package Bidder list, Commercial Bid Evaluation, Recommendation to Purchase and Purchase Requisition;      Participate in the RFQ preparation, bid- and Vendor qualification;      Define the negotiation strategy with the Buyer, Project Manager and Supply Chain Department Manager;        You will manage the execution of the PO technically and commercially and you make sure the PO execution is in line with the project schedule;      Ensure the Vendor Documents are received , reviewed and approved on time in the Vendor Documentation Management tool;      Receive, control and close the TQs, NCRs, SVRs in liaison with Engineering and PM;      Manage the inspection, the delivery and receipt of the package at site with the help of the Inspection, Expediting and Logistic teams & Site Material Controller.            REQUIREMENTS         Bachelor s or Master s degree in relevant field of Engineering   Minimum of 5 years of experience in the Oil & Gas, Petrochemical, or similar business in a technical and/or commercial position, preferably in the role as a Package Manager or Engineer.     You possess:     a self- starter who possesses good interpersonal and organizational skills;     a great Time Management skills;    a proactive behavior;    a high capacity to be flexible and adaptable to react to operational changes;       Fluent in English (both written and verbally)      International travel may be required.

column2: Provides technically complex engineering solutions in particularly challenging project environments in accordance with TechnipFMC standards, procedures and processes, schedules and budget, with a continuous concern for quality, targets, and customer satisfaction.        Job Description       Leads and supports project engineering, new product/technology development, product improvement and product standardization, and product qualification projects depending upon the assigned group.       Serves as a technical point of contact for assigned work package scope and may serve as a focal point for all communications related to scope.       Develops product design, geometry standards documentation and product qualification requirements.       Creates, reviews/approves part reports, drawings, engineering specifications and standards.       Defines product quality, material, welding, and NDE requirements.       Supports and manage project schedule and deliverables.       Provides Management with technical assistance and work progress updates as requested.       Mentors and provides technical guidance to Product Engineers and Designers/Drafters. Works collaboratively to accomplish project tasks. Provides independent review and approval of work packages.       Provides vendors technical assistance and builds strong working relationships.       Works to the requirements of industry code related to subsea production systems, TechnipFMC standards and client specifications.       Adheres to all relevant work instructions and design guidelines, clearly demonstrates creativity and innovation in finding solutions and alternatives.       Develops unique solutions for complex technical problems that may include the design of new products/systems or the development of solutions having few or no precedents.       This is an individual contributor position. The role is responsible for executing activities assigned by the manager, and execute it with the assigned team.      Main Tasks       Consistently leads work packages and resources on a project basis. Ensures that project members understand business goals and creates energy and action toward those goals. Encourages and empowers others to achieve.       Reviews and approves engineering designs (i.e. drawings, part reports, specifications, etc.) of existing and new technology or projects. Ensures that assignments meet standards and performance requirements within area of expertise.       Actively manages and provides timely updates to engineering schedule, and engineering updates to the project and engineering management team.       Prepares documentation, information, and communications such as ECN (Engineering Change Notices), part reports, and engineering specifications and ensures conformance to all policies and procedures related to engineering functions, labor reporting and systems reporting.       Facilitate RCAs and provide design solutions to correct non-conformances while taking into account safety, quality, schedule, and cost.       Support Quality Notification dispositions and supply chain issues as they arise.       Provide expert technical support to equipment manufacturing, fabrication, assembly, Factory acceptance test (FAT) and System integration test (SIT) activities.       Works with other engineering teams to ensure good communication of workload requirements and consistent approaches to analytical models and methodologies.       Works with technical authorities in the company to define technical requirements which are appropriate for the products and consistent with industry practices.       Finds creative solutions to multi-faceted and/or time-sensitive, complex problems. Identifies and utilizes available technical resources throughout TechnipFMC and externally.       Consults with other departments on equipment designs. Anticipates potential problems and proactively solves complex problems through creative thinking, using internal and external resources.       Prepares technical data and papers for sales personnel, customers, and publications. Makes presentations to customer management groups.       Actively increases industry knowledge base through technical publications, forums, committee participation, trade shows, etc.       Assists engineering manager with any requested technical and engineering related tasks      You are meant for this job if:       Degreed Mechanical Engineer with at least 6-years of Engineering experience in the Subsea Production System engineering, reduced to 4-years for Masters/PhD candidates.       Demonstrated experience in supporting engineering for subsea projects constrained by safety, quality, delivery, and cost requirements.       Experience in reviewing & approving engineering designs, documents, layouts, calculations and interpreting FEA/ structural analysis results.       Strong knowledge of engineering discipline and physical modeling techniques (solid mechanics, fluid dynamics, heat transfer) is required. Experience conducting design analysis - hoop stress, flexibility, buckling, burst, fatigue, etc.       Work experience must include experience with various ASME, API, NORSOK, and DNV Codes and Standards as it relates to subsea equipment design and manufacturing.       Exposure to various manufacturing processes - forging, hot and cold extrusion, cladding, HIP, induction bending etc       Exposure to welding codes and practices - ASME IX and API 1104.       Exposure to NDE codes and practices - UT, PAUT, PT, RT, MPI per ASME V.       Ability to manage the engineering projects within specified schedule and budget. Demonstrated organization and project planning skills.       Accuracy, dependability, ability to manage schedule and prioritize work for self and others in team.       Ability to work independently and as a part of a technical team - a self-motivated, self-starter.       Ability to make independent system recommendations utilizing advanced analytical and problem-solving skills.       Strong written and verbal communication skills in English with ability to effectively transfer subject matter expertise. Ability to coach and mentor others.       Ability to design complex engineering plans and review design work for systems and products.
column13: Fabrication, Supply chain, Solid mechanics, Fluid dynamics, Analytical, System integration, Product design, Project planning, Technical support, Structural analysis

column2: The Buyer is responsible to source, negotiate and purchase equipment/services in line with budget, schedule, quality and technical project requirements while ensuring that any procurement activity complies with Group Supply Chain strategy processes.      RESPONSIBILITIES      Lead the tender process in a fair manner and identify Bidders that will best meet SBMs technical requirements, budget and schedule constrains. Understand the contractual requirements of equipment/service to be purchased and elaborate the bid package together with the relevant disciplines (Eng, Legal, etc)      Ensure that Vendor Qualification process is performed as per SBM rules      Issue Request For Quotation, expedite and collect offers from Bidders      Analyze the offers and identify areas for commercial or contractual clarifications in order to facilitate discussion with Bidders and get offers aligned and in line with SBM requirements      Develop recommendations for the Bidder selection based on the input from the relevant disciplines and on the assessment of offered costs, technical requirements and delivery time in accordance with SBM Ethics and Compliance rules (eg competition rules )      Fully document the tendering process (i.e. Commercial Bid Evaluation, Recommendation To Purchase )      Ensure that the tactical management of the procurement process (from RFQ preparation till Recommendation To Purchase) is conducted appropriately and in full compliance with SBM Working Procedures.      Set up package strategy with close coordination of Package Manager to lead commercial negotiations, using any possible leverage to achieve your targets and obtain competitive pricing      Perform financial/commercial analysis (market intelligence, cost breakdown structure, benchmark ) of the current scenarios, identify Risks and Opportunities and recommend options that can drive the final decision to purchase.      Conduct internal contract check points all along the Purchase Order execution to ensure contractual protections are in place and to minimize contractual /financial risks.      Be responsible for managing any claims with Vendors and develop appropriate settlement plan       REQUIREMENTS      Bachelor s or Master s degree in relevant field of Engineering or Business Administration and a minimum of 5 years of experience as a Buyer with an Oil and Gas or EPC company.     Broad and deep procurement experience in the Offshore, Marine or Petrochemical Industry.     International travel may be required.      Furthermore, you are or you have:     a self- starter who possesses good interpersonal and organizational skills;      great Time Management skills;      proactive behavior;      Flexible and adaptable to react to operational changes;      Willingness to travel;      Fluent in English (both written and verbally)

column2: Supplier Qualification: Support a cross-functional team by assessing supplier capabilities, auditing supplier quality management system processes, etc         Product and Process Qualification: Lead or support cross-functional teams to perform Product and Process Qualification (PPQ) on commodity parts and systems according to applicable process descriptions and standards. Leading includes the planning, tracking, and reporting of project milestones as well as budget and resource needs.          Support the supplier quality assurance measures along the complete PPQ. Approve supplier process via submitted Manufacturing Quality Control Plan.         Perform source / virtual / desk inspection of suppliers of components and systems in the area of responsibility.         Coordinate nonconformance processing at the supplier and ensure appropriate actions are taken to prevent recurrence.         Monitor supplier Key Performance Indicators and adjust quality, inspection, and development planning activities accordingly.         Facilitate recurring supplier qualification development status meetings. Ensure qualifications are on track and potentials risks are identified.         Work with various Supplier Quality Development tools and databases. Ensure data quality and transparency.           Your profile     A Snapshot of Your Day     As Supplier Quality Engineer for Mechanical System and Large Steel Fabrications, you will conduct supplier qualification, development and quality assurance measures    You will be working and close networking with multi-cultural environment with different departments locally and globally   Closely collaborating with the global SCM process   SQE is using digitalization tools to improve our processes   SQE is addressing nonconformance with conducting containment, RCA, and implementing preventative measures risk mitigation measures     How You ll Make an Impact    Supplier Qualification: Support a multi-functional team by assessing supplier capabilities, auditing supplier quality management system processes, etc   Product and Process Qualification: Lead or support multi-functional teams to perform Product and Process Qualification (PPQ) on commodity parts and systems according to applicable process descriptions and standards. Leading includes the planning, tracking, and reporting of project landmarks as well as budget and resource needs.   Support the supplier quality assurance measures along the complete PPQ. Approve supplier process via submitted Manufacturing Quality Control Plan.   Perform source / virtual / desk inspection of suppliers of components and systems in the area of responsibility.   Coordinate nonconformance processing at the supplier and ensure appropriate actions are taken to prevent recurrence.   Monitor supplier Key Performance Indicators and adjust quality, inspection, and development planning activities accordingly.   Facilitate recurring supplier qualification development status meetings. Ensure qualifications are on track and potentials risks are identified.   Work with various Supplier Quality Development tools and databases. Ensure data quality and transparency.    What You Bring    Bachelor or master s degree or equivalent experience in mechanical, industrial engineering, or a similar field. Equivalent combination of education, training, and experience will be considered.   technical experience with industrial process technology and /or auxiliary systems in energy generation plants (enclosures, steel structures, piping, pressure vessels, skids, etc)   knowledge in welding and coating.   familiar with respective ISO ASME code requirements (eg ISO-3834, AWS D1.1)   Strong written and verbal communication skills in English   Familiarity with root cause analysis and other quality risk management methodologies   10 + years experience in technical field and/or working in Supply Chain   Open minded, results solution oriented and good analytical thinking. column2: Be the face and voice of the customer within Esko.     Keep the customer informed and updated as you get things fixed. column2: The Project Procurement Manager (PPM) is responsible for Supply Chain activities performed during    the project and he/she ensures that services, equipment and materials under Supply Chain (SC)    scope are free issued to fabrication yards as per project requirements in terms of safety, cost,    schedule and quality.    For all Equipment under Project Management Office (PMO) responsibility, PPM shall provide support    to PMO during RFQ phase by leading the buyer team and during the PO execution by providing the    Post Order Management (POM) support required by PMO.    The PPM supervises the SC team assigned to the project. He/she reports progress of the SC    Purchase Orders and associated activities to the Project Management Team (PMT), local Supply    Chain manager and if required, to the Client representative.     ROLE CONTRIBUTION     1. In order that effective procurement control is established from the beginning of the Execution Phase you are to:     1.1 For the Supply Chain scope, develop the Project Procurement Strategy during the Win   Phase with Category Managers, local SC Manager, SBM Operations representative and   cascade this to the project SC team.   1.2 Define solutions to address identified clients requirements (eg POs STC set up, "back   to back" solutions).   1.3 Define SBM Operations requirement to be considered in the SC strategy.   1.4 Define in coordination with the relevant Category Manager(s) the most appropriate strategy   to be implemented for strategic scopes/vendors   1.5 Assess SC project risk and identify associated mitigation actions   1.6 Define lead-time and values for Supply Chain Purchase Orders and associated contingency   1.7 Liaise with Product Line Supply Chain Manager to set up SC budget and associated   manpower planning   1.8 Act as the main focal point with estimating department to consolidate project supply chain   information for estimation purposes associated to Supply Chain scope   1.9 Develop Supply Chain Execution Plan (SCEP) when required   1.10 Undertake preparatory project execution activities (SC templates, pre-populating tools,   contractual specificities etc)   1.11 Be responsible for monitoring of project supply chain budget and for project supply chain   reporting     The measure of your effectiveness in this will be:     Supply Chain scope is clearly identified with associated budget and manhours and validated by PMT and Product Line Supply Chain Manager   ?  PROJECT PROCUREMENT MANAGER    2. In order that Supply Chain delivery meets project requirements you are to:    2.1 Lead the project SC team and support them to deliver goods and services allocated to   Supply Chain within project constraints, ensuring that the overall quality of purchased   equipment and services meets project performance expectations.   2.2 Liaise with PMO for support required to be provided during PO execution to PMO to   deliver goods and services allocated to PMO.   2.3 Manage workload and priorities of the project SC team for scope allocated to Supply   Chain to ensure compliance with project milestones and liaise with SC Managers to   resolve any workload/resourcing issue   2.4 Review and provide input to the project planning to optimize SC activities in line with   engineering and construction constraints   2.5 Resolve multi-disciplinary topics with PMT colleagues (Engineering Project Manager,   Project Controls Manager, Completion Manager, Delivery/Project Manager, ).   2.6 Get support from SC Managers to ensure SC team members have proper awareness on   relevant tools, processes methodology.   2.7 Ensure that all relevant Quality Regulatory Management and HSE, Project and Group   Procedures related to supply chain activities are understood and enforced by the project   SC team.   2.8 Monitor implementation and ensure compliance Project Procurement Strategy.   2.9 Report to Strategic Sourcing team feedback on applicability of developed strategies or   GFA with an ultimate goal of continuous improvement   2.10 Monitor SC risk exposure throughout the project execution phase and implement an   appropriate action plan.   2.11 Maintain the Quality and Safety performance of all members of the project SC team    The measure of your effectiveness in this will be:   % of Purchase Orders delivered on time and on budget   SC resource consumption (man-hours) aligned with forecast   External and internal stakeholders satisfaction

column1: IT Service and Change Manager- Strategic Sourcing
column2: Your role as an IT Service and Change Manager - Strategic Sourcing is to support the implementation of our digitalization projects   You will be making valuable contributions through ensuring smooth utilization and release implementation of digital solutions specially SAP End to End (E2E) Ariba implementation project   You will work and co-ordinate with Global business users related to resolving Incidents and implementing Change requests related to Strategic Sourcing in SAP E2E Ariba project   You will coordinate and work with the appropriate IT development and middleware Teams to find a solution that meets the agreed operation Level Agreement and fix it within the agreed Service Level Agreement   Besides that, you will coordinate and plan the Testing for the application and join the related meetings to understand and keep up with the ongoing developments   Work closely with stakeholders, expand your network and prepare yourself for future global roles at Siemens Energy      How You ll Make an Impact     Our team is actively supporting the Siemens Energy Digital Transformation, a global digitization initiative launched to optimize the functionality of Siemens Energy Supply Chain Management   We are looking for a driven, self-motivated individual with excellent service orientation and skills/experience in operational procurement to support the implementation of our digitalization projects   You will be making valuable contributions through ensuring smooth utilization and release implementation of digital solutions       IT Key point of contact for Business for Source to Contract processes   Service, Change Management / Coordinator for End-to-End Procurement, translator and coordinator between business and Tech team.   Coordinate with Incident, Problem, Configuration managers to share information or coordinate action on emergency Change Requests   To plan, elaborate, design and maintenance of assigned tasks /action list (IT focus)   Development and controlling of time schedule together with Project Leads   Controlling of implementation progress and execution of IT relevant testing   Status reporting to related stakeholders   Ensure business acceptance of handed over solution results.   Ensure knowledge transfer from SAP to own responsibility of implemented functions and smooth handover to stable operations.   Review the Change Request documentation (process, work instructions, best practices)   Challenge requirements against standards and harmonized processes   Willingness for Hands-on work assigned to check, review and activate/customize the new features released by SAP.    What You Bring    You should be 6-8 years experienced IT professional with Graduation in Engineering or equivalent.   Having hands on experience of SAP Ariba Sourcing and SLP   Having knowledge of SAP S4 HANA Central Procurement - Central Sourcing or Central Contract Management is an advantage.   Having experience of SCM Procurement Processes (source-to-contract)   Having experience of Project and Service Management, ITIL / Operations Management   Having good knowledge of ITSM Service Now, Jira, Change and Request modules is an advantage.   Having hands on experience of Requirement engineering / translator (business - IT service provider)   Having hands on experience in Stakeholder Management

column2: This position will have responsibility of handling all Account Payables, Fixed Assets, Inventory and GL Accounting for India.     Main responsibilities and key activities:     The incumbent will also be responsible for managing the team to deliver on the following duties:     Processing daily accounts payable transactions and ensures the follow-up of all outstanding items for area of responsibility    Analysing vendor accounts and preparing reconciliations and aging reports.    Timely payment to vendors,    Resolving invoice discrepancies; maintaining records and vendor files, GST Input follow-up.    Prepare and post journal entries and monthly accruals.    Complete month end closings, including inventory and Fixed Assets as assigned accurately and on time.    Calculate and analyse inventory, including booking of E&O reserve    Prepare and assist with documentation for internal and External audits.    Reconcile general ledger and intercompany accounts.    Perform financial control/SOX testing and compliance.    Work with IT to troubleshoot and implement business systems updates.    Assist with financial reporting and special projects as needed.    Understanding the billing processes to provide guidance to customers, identifying defects and driving resolutions upstream of AR     *This description is a summary of principle responsibilities and is not intended to include all duties may be assigned.     Qualifications and professional knowledge:     Bachelors Degree in Finance, Accounts or Business    4+ years of experience in the areas of finance, business management and/or sales operations    4+ years of business-to-business collections experience    Demonstrates excellent communication (written and spoken) skills in English.    Excellent Microsoft Excel skill. Knowledge in MS AX/ Dynamics is a plus     Competencies (personal qualifications):      Positive, multi-tasking, and good team player and be able to communicate effectively in a cross functional & cross regions environment    Communicate with different internal customers to ensure positive outcome    Strong business acumen with strong analytical and problem-solving techniques    Have sound business ethics and consistency among principles, values and behaviors, and adhere to policies and procedures, and be able to exercise judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine the appropriate action.    Adhere to policies and procedures, and be able to exercise judgments within defined procedures and practices to determine the appropriate action    Positive attitude, fast learner and multi-tasking.

column2: ?   This posting has for objective to give ourselves the chance to work together, in the short, medium, or long term. SBM Offshores active leadership position on the market, combined with our People Development and Succession Planning activities, requires us to be ready to onboard and mobilize our future   Engineering Project Engineers   as soon as a new vacancy opens!      You are considering a new challenge in a few weeks, months, or even yearsIf you match the requirements below, APPLY NOW!       ROLE      The Engineering Project Engineer provides support to the Engineering Project Manager (EPM) in managing engineering work including engineering deliverables, man-hour and schedule control.     The Engineering Project Engineer works across all engineering disciplines to ensure work performed on the project is in accordance with SBM quality, systems and safety requirements.      RESPONSIBILITIES      Provide support to the EPM to define and develop discipline scope by understanding and evaluating project requirements     Ensure the project team is fully aware of project requirements and specifications and delivers a design that meets project needs, corporate standards, and industry regulations.     Collaborate with EPM and Discipline Leads in preparing the engineering schedule and manpower planning, ensuring work is completed in accordance with the overall project milestones.     Achieve effective interface management by:     Ensuring Discipline Leads give full consideration to construction and installation aspects of their designs, as well as cost and schedule implications of their work     Assist EPM in resolving discipline issues between the relevantDiscipline Leads and stakeholders in Construction, Procurement and Project Controls     Establish and maintain close working relationship with EPM, Project Management Team, Operations, Procurement, Construction and Client     Understand and monitor all interfaces with Class Society/otherregulatory bodies and Clients to ensure requirements are properly addressed and relevant documents are reviewed timely     Assist EPM in preparing project close-out, including as-built documentation and engineering close-out reports     Provide assistance to EPM on below for ensuring engineering deliverables achieve required quality and safety by:     Ensuring work is performed in accordance with project requirements and specifications     Organizing regular inter-discipline review meetings, interfacechecks     Ensure Design Reviews include the appropriate attendees and manage the action register to monitor the close-out of identified action items     Identifying dependencies and obtaining alignment with project stakeholders to ensure safety and quality are not sacrificed in the effort to meet the project schedule     Manage change (MOC) with minimum impact on the overall project     Track and coordinate changes with Discipline Leads ensuring team members follow the management of change process; ensure recorded changes are followed through     Proactively identify and monitor areas likely to change to reduce the surprise element, added costs and delays to project     Act as MOC coordinator/ Engineer     Ensure all changes are reported timely, coordinated with all disciplines for inputs and alignment with PMT for approval (schedule and budget)     Timely implementation of MOCs and aligning with project control on schedule     MOC communication management with all key stake holders (PMT, Engineering disciplines, Construction Procurement)     Act as vendor data management / Hold coordinator / manager     Vendor data tacker management     Ensure the latest approved /agreed vendor data is available toproject team (engineers and designers)     Ensuring the verification of the data before isometrics / design documents are released     Hold management of the engineering deliverables by reporting status of the vendor data availability and working closely with engineering and supply chain      REQUIREMENTS      BE/BTech or ME/MTech in any engineering with 8 year experience.

column2: Logistics Management:     Identifying, networking, develop key logistics companies /stakeholders to move material to and from in the supply chain across India     Work closely with different verticals to ensure on-time movement of material to client / vendor locations based on pre-approved shipping schedules     Work with logistic companies, freight forwarders and liners to establish least time and cost factors to help with export of material from site locations     Track consignments and update internal teams as and when needed      Continuous Improvement:      Identify opportunities to improve loading and unloading time at site locations by deploying innovative strategies working closely with site teams     Identify and sign long-term MOUs with logistics companies involving export freight     Identify areas to improve efficiency, and safety and bring down costs per kg of material moved     Deploy appropriate material handling equipment like ramps, conveyors, and forklifts at the site locations      Reporting and Documentation:      Maintain various due-diligence and other required documentation at vendor level, managing, monitoring and reviewing it periodically.     Ensure timely, concise and accurate reports on a daily, weekly and monthly basis on prescribed formats for all material handled as logistics.     Ensure timely, concise and accurate CRM updates like shipment tracker, schedule tracker, payment tracker etc.     Manage and maintain end to end documentation of export shipment and inland shipments     Help managers and teams to capture information from the field as and when required.      General responsibilities:      Ensure professionalism at all times and demonstrate exemplary prioritization of workload skills.     Ensure that the PFC policies, SOPs and protocols are being adhered to at all levels of the company.     Ensure strict adherence to data confidentiality and security.     Willingness to travel frequently across PFC site locations, sometimes at short notice, including other places as per need of project or the company.     Work closely with the PFC team and Partners.     Note: The roles and responsibilities outlined above are not meant to be an exhaustive list of tasks. Flexibility is required and the incumbent is expected to carry out any other related duties that are necessary for the optimum functioning of the company as a whole within the employee's skills and abilities whenever a need is pointed out, becomes apparent or as reasonably instructed.      KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE QUALIFICATIONS    Any graduate with a minimum of 4 years of experience in the logistics field.     Good understanding of logistics operations     Experience working in a logistics firm would be an added advantage.     Fluency in Kannada / Tamil, Hindi and English.      Does that sound like you       Good interpersonal skills and ability to work in the field alone.     Open to new challenges.     Good data management, documentation, and reporting skills.     Good computer skills MS Office and Working on CRM.     Ability to work under pressure and prioritize tasks.     Eye for detail.     Able to learn new systems, methods, processes and procedures.     Able to meet deadlines and produce quality outputs.     Proactive and self-motivated.     Humility, honesty, transparency, integrity and ability to maintain confidentiality

column2: The primary responsibility of the Mechanic Steam and Gas - is to safely accomplish the installation, maintenance and repair of the heavy rotating machinery used mainly in power generation applications. Turbine Mechanics work closely with Supervisors, EHS personnel, and the Operations Department to achieve these goals. You may be assigned other duties to help proactively drive our FieldCore vision and align with our organization s core values.       ?    Essential Duties & Responsibilities:     Read blueprints, schematic drawings and technical documentation to determine proper work procedures.   Install machinery and equipment according to layout plans, blueprints and other drawings in industrial establishments.   Dismantle and assemble machinery and equipment using a variety of hand, power, pneumatic and hydraulic tools.   Perform mechanical and electrical maintenance and repairs on power tools, hand tools and training equipment.   Move machinery and equipment using hoists, cranes, chain falls and trucks.   Align machinery and equipment using hoists, squares, rules, micrometers, plumb bobs, dial indicators and/or laser alignment equipment.   Perform machining and welding operations for making various parts for lab and shop training equipment   Perform material and machine inspections using precision measuring equipment such as micrometers, rules, calipers, protractors, and torque wrenches.   Responsible for shipping and receiving all major pieces for T&DC, plus all shipping, receiving, inventory, and control of tools, equipment and supplies   Determine equipment specifications and prepare parts lists for purchasing, consisting of mechanical, electrical, and hydraulic devices as needed to complete assigned projects.   Load, transport, and unload materials, tools, equipment and supplies.   Availability to travel and be away from home for extended periods of time   Ability and willingness to work holidays, weekends and overtime as required by field assignments Field       Required Qualifications & Experience  :    Degree or associate degree in Technical Field, Gas Turbine Systems Technician preferred   Must have a minimum of two (2) years experience maintaining, dismantling, and installing machinery and industrial service equipment including various pumps, motors, fans, generators, and turbines.   Must have experience performing equipment alignments using either laser or traditional methods.   Must have Driver s License   Must possess minimum required hand tools.       Desired Characteristics:     Qualified level. Able to successfully perform all requirements of the job properly.   Possess advanced skills and applies the fundamental concepts, practices and procedures of a particular field of specialization.   Has solid skills acquired with trainings and required to disassemble and reassemble complex rotating equipment Bolting, Hydraulic Bolting, Flange Management, Small Bore Piping, Basic Rigging/Lifting, O/H Crane Operator   Good mechanical/technical skills.   Good oral communication skills and critical thinking ability.   May be required to handle time-sensitive tasks and maintain a schedule within operationally challenging environments.   Must work well both independently and in a team environment.
column13: EHS, Hydraulics, Pumps, Mechanical, Gas turbine, Machinery, Power tools, Power generation, Crane Operator, Technical documentation

column2: This position reports to Export LC Senior Manager and assists on Export LC related document preparation/checking activities involved in a Trade Finance transaction. Knowledge of all life cycle events of letters of credit (import and export - issue, advise amend, acceptance, discount, payment, checking documents)       Minimum of   3-5 years   of Export LC document checking according to UCP 600 and ISBP 745 for Export Letters of Credit        Adhere to governing rules and all relevant controls.       Develop and improve effective working relationships with all trade stakeholders including banks.       Discrepancy Resolution by working with banks, third parties, and customers.       Proficient in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Microsoft Outlook, SWIFT.      Experience: 3-4 years in Trade Finance set up     Qualification: Graduate in any field. Also knowledge of    CDCS   will be added advantage

column2: GPS Renewables is looking for Manager/Senior Manager - Supply Chain Management (SCM) to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey   Supply Chain Planning: Assist in developing supply chain strategies, plans, and policies to meet business objectives, including demand forecasting, procurement, inventory management, and distribution   Vendor and Supplier Management: Collaborate with suppliers and vendors to ensure timely and cost-effective sourcing of materials, products, or services   Negotiate contracts and agreements   Inventory Management: Oversee inventory levels, monitor stock movement, and implement inventory control measures to optimize carrying costs and stock availability   Production Coordination: Work with production and manufacturing teams to schedule production, align with demand forecasts, and ensure efficient production processes   Distribution and Logistics: Manage the transportation, warehousing, and distribution of products to ensure timely and efficient delivery to customers or end-users   Order Fulfillment: Oversee the order processing and fulfillment to ensure that customer orders are processed accurately and delivered on time   Demand Planning: Collaborate with sales and marketing teams to understand market demand and plan for product availability   Compliance: Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, import/export regulations, and ethical standards in the supply chain   Cost Control: Monitor supply chain costs and identify cost-saving opportunities through process optimization and efficient resource utilization   Process Improvement: Identify opportunities to streamline and improve supply chain processes for efficiency and cost-effectiveness   Team Management: Supervise and lead a team of supply chain professionals, providing guidance, training, and support as needed   Technology Utilization: Leverage supply chain management software and systems to improve visibility, accuracy, and decision-making within the supply chain

column2: We are looking for the right people people who want to innovate, achieve, grow, and lead. We are one of the world s leading providers of products and services to the global energy industry. With a presence in more than 70 countries and 130 nationalities represented in our workforce, we are one of the world s most diverse companies. This allows us to offer multiple career paths, best-in-class training, and world-class benefits.    Landmark provides E&P professionals with software-driven lifecycle insights that generate new ideas, actions, and results to maximize asset value. We are looking to recruit an experienced Delivery Manager to work with a set of global development teams. You will be responsible for leading a set of teams to plan, organize and deliver high-quality product releases in an efficient and cost-effective manner.        Roles and Responsibilities       Plan, organize, and manage project resources to ensure timely delivery of projects   Collaborate with scrum masters and team leads to ensure on-time, on-scope delivery of technical solutions   Staffing, career development and management of scrum teams   Allocation of resources   Productivity assessments   Delivery of technically sound solutions by ensuring that the solutions produced meet the accepted technical standards   Ensure produced solutions are cost-effective, performant and high quality   Ensure re-use of technical components and reduction of duplication   Assist product management teams in scoping and costing of technical solutions   Staying current on existing and emerging technologies relevant to the role      Development Leadership    Successfully manage globally distributed teams   Lead scrum teams in working effectively to satisfy software delivery goals and strong collaboration across roles   IT and cloud savvy, able to understand required technology and infrastructure needed to support the Software Development function (Tools, Processes, Architecture)   Ability to create, communicate, and execute an effective Software Development vision and strategy   Provide leadership across the company to enable continuous improvement in Software Development best practices within the organization (e.g., work with IT, Business, and Production Operations)        Required Skills       BS or MS in Computer Science or related Engineering discipline   8+ years of experience in leading Software Development teams in the delivery of complex applications. Excellent understanding of design principles and best practices   6+ years of software development experience in the cloud   Experience in software architecture and system design   Experience with Kubernetes-based applications   Proven experience delivering cloud-based products   Solid understanding of how to build publicly exposed APIs while adhering to best practices   Familiarity with build pipeline tools and technologies such as: Jenkins and GitLab Runner   Excellent analytical, communication and leadership skills   Must be self-motivated but be able to work well in a team environment   Team player; willing to coach junior team members and cooperate on cross-functional problem solving   Experience with leading Cloud and SaaS Development: Azure and/or AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, etc.   Self-Starter; willing to learn new technologies, ability to learn fast   Working in an Agile development environment       Desired Skills:       Experience in the Oil & Gas industry   Experience migrating thick applications into the cloud   Experience optimizing SaaS delivery processes   Experience with Open Subsurface Data Universe (OSDU)     Total Years of Experience: 14+ years   Location: Bangalore, Karnataka, India.       Education and Experience       8+ years of experience in leading Software Development teams   6+ years of software development experience in the cloud  BE/ BTech/ ME/ MTech/ BS/ MS in computer science or related STEM field
